original: thams cad kyi nad g-yog byed mi nus na yang de'i tshe rim pa bstan pa sngar smras pa bzhin du nad g-yog bya ste /
analyzed: thams cad kyi nad g-yog byed mi nus na yang de'i tshe rim pa bstan pa sngar smras pa bzhin du nad g-yog bya ste /
translated: If you are unable to nurse all of them, then you should nurse them in the order taught above.

original: ze dang por slob dpon gyi nad g-yog bya'o //🔽de med na lhan cig gnas pa'i'o //
analyzed: ze dang por slob dpon gyi nad g-yog bya'o // de med na lhan cig gnas pa'i'o //
translated: First you should nurse the teacher.

original: de med na nye gnas kyi'o //
analyzed: de med na nye gnas kyi'o //
translated: If he is not available, then you should nurse the co-resident.🔽If he is not available, then you should nurse the pupil.

original: de med na mkhan po gcig pa la sogs pa rim bzhin du 'grogs bshes kyi mthar thug pa'i bar dag gi nad g-yog bya bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de med na mkhan po gcig pa la sogs pa rim bzhin du 'grogs bshes kyi mthar thug pa'i bar dag gi nad g-yog bya bar rig par bya'o //
translated: If he is not available, then you should nurse the co-student, and so on, in order, up to the intimate friend.

original: gzhan la yang nad g-yog gi chog 'dra bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan la yang nad g-yog gi chog 'dra bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the proper way to nurse others, he says:

original: 'dir de'i rtags brtsams pa yang rab tu byung ba dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'dir de'i rtags brtsams pa yang rab tu byung ba dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Here, the beginning of the signs of his illness is like that of the renunciate.

original: 'dir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Here means

original: nad g-yog bya ba la'o //
analyzed: nad g-yog bya ba la'o //
translated: in nursing the sick.

original: gang gis rab tu byung ba'i rtags brtsams pa de ni de'i rtags brtsams pa ste /
analyzed: gang gis rab tu byung ba'i rtags brtsams pa de ni de'i rtags brtsams pa ste /
translated: The beginning of the signs of his illness is the beginning of the signs of the illness of the one who is like a renunciate.

original: gal te rab tu 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te rab tu 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: If he is going forth,

original: skra breg pa la sogs pa'i rtags tsam gyis bdag nyid bcos par gyur pa de ni /
analyzed: skra breg pa la sogs pa'i rtags tsam gyis bdag nyid bcos par gyur pa de ni /
translated: One who merely changes his appearance by shaving his head and so on,🔽

original: rab tu byung ba dang 'dra bar ba lta bar bya ste /🔽ji ltar rab tu byung ba'i nad g-yog bstan pa bzhin du de'i rtags brtsams pa'i nad g-yog kyang @69a * //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba dang 'dra bar ba lta bar bya ste / ji ltar rab tu byung ba'i nad g-yog bstan pa bzhin du de'i rtags brtsams pa'i nad g-yog kyang @69a * //
translated: One should regard that person who has merely taken on the outward appearance of a monk, such as shaving the head and face, as a fake monk.

original: de kho na bzhin du bya'o //
analyzed: de kho na bzhin du bya'o //
translated: Just as one should care for a sick monk, so one should care for a sick person who merely has the outward appearance of a monk.

original: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa na na yal bar mi dor ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa na na yal bar mi dor ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not abandon a fellow brahmacārin who is sick.

original: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa gang la la zhig na bar gyur na de dge 'dun du dge slong dag gis yal bar mi dor ba ste /
analyzed: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa gang la la zhig na bar gyur na de dge 'dun du dge slong dag gis yal bar mi dor ba ste /
translated: If any fellow brahmacārin becomes sick, the monks in the saṅgha should not abandon him.

original: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa zhes smos pa ni nges pa kho nar bya ba bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa zhes smos pa ni nges pa kho nar bya ba bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The expression “fellow brahmacārin” is used to indicate that this is a definite duty.

original: ji ltar yal bar mi dor ba de bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar yal bar mi dor ba de bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show how one should not abandon him, it is said:

original: de la nad g-yog med na mthar thug pa man chad las bsko bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la nad g-yog med na mthar thug pa man chad las bsko bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If he has no attendant, one should appoint one up to the end of life.

original: nad pa de la nad g-yog med na de dge 'dun du gyur pa'i dge slong dag gis nad g-yog bsko'o //
analyzed: nad pa de la nad g-yog med na de dge 'dun du gyur pa'i dge slong dag gis nad g-yog bsko'o //
translated: If the sick person has no attendant, the monks who are members of the saṅgha should take turns as his attendant.

original: gang man chad las bsko bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: gang man chad las bsko bar bya zhe na /
translated: From what point on should one take turns?

original: de'i phyir mthar thug pa man chad las zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mthar thug pa man chad las zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it says, “from the point of the final member.”

original: mthar thug pa man chad las zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mthar thug pa man chad las zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The point of the final member means

original: gal te nad g-yog gcig gis nad pa'i bya ba thams cad sgrub par mi nus na de'i tshe gnyis pa bsko'o //
analyzed: gal te nad g-yog gcig gis nad pa'i bya ba thams cad sgrub par mi nus na de'i tshe gnyis pa bsko'o //
translated: if one attendant is unable to do all the work for the sick person, then a second one should be appointed.

original: gal te de gnyis kyis kyang byar mi nus na /
analyzed: gal te de gnyis kyis kyang byar mi nus na /
translated: If even two are unable to do it,

original: de'i tshe gsum pa la sogs pa nas dge 'dun gyi mthar thug pa man chad las bsko bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe gsum pa la sogs pa nas dge 'dun gyi mthar thug pa man chad las bsko bar bya'o //
translated: then a third and so on should be appointed, up to the final member of the saṅgha.

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Here is the text:

original: thams cad med na dge 'dun gyis nang pa'i gnas skabs yongs su shes par bya ste /
analyzed: thams cad med na dge 'dun gyis nang pa'i gnas skabs yongs su shes par bya ste /
translated: If none are available, the saṅgha should understand the situation.

original: nad g-yog gcig gam gnyis sam rab tu mang po bsko bar bya zhing /
analyzed: nad g-yog gcig gam gnyis sam rab tu mang po bsko bar bya zhing /
translated: One, two, or many attendants should be appointed.

original: cher na dge 'dun thams cad kyis nad g-yog bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: cher na dge 'dun thams cad kyis nad g-yog bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: At most, the entire saṅgha should attend the sick person.

original: sman brtag par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sman brtag par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to examine the medicine,

original: dge 'dun las byung ba'i sman ni nang pa 'ba' zhig gis spyad du rung ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dge 'dun las byung ba'i sman ni nang pa 'ba' zhig gis spyad du rung ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: the medicine that arises from the Saṅgha is suitable to be used by insiders alone.

original: sman ni spyad du rung ngo //
analyzed: sman ni spyad du rung ngo //
translated: The medicine is suitable to be used.

original: gang las byung ba zhe na /
analyzed: gang las byung ba zhe na /
translated: From what does it arise?

original: dge 'dun las byung ba'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun las byung ba'o //
translated: It arises from the Saṅgha.

original: sus she na nad pa 'ba' zhig gis te /
analyzed: sus she na nad pa 'ba' zhig gis te /
translated: Who uses it? Only the sick.

original: nad g-yog la sogs pas spyod du mi rung ngo ;🔽/'dir gzhung ni khyim bdag sgre bo'i rdzas las sman gang yin pa de dge 'dun gyi sman khang du gzhag par bya zhing /
analyzed: nad g-yog la sogs pas spyod du mi rung ngo ; /'dir gzhung ni khyim bdag sgre bo'i rdzas las sman gang yin pa de dge 'dun gyi sman khang du gzhag par bya zhing /
translated: It is not suitable to be used by the nurse and so on.

original: dge slong nad pa dag gis longs spyad par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: dge slong nad pa dag gis longs spyad par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Here the text says: “Whatever medicine there is from the property of the householder Aḍāla, that should be placed in the Saṅgha’s medicine house and used by sick monks.”

original: de skad gsungs pa de mdo 'dis bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: de skad gsungs pa de mdo 'dis bsdus pa yin no //
translated: The statement is included in this sūtra.

original: med pa nyid yin na de nad g-yog gis tshol du gzhug go zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: med pa nyid yin na de nad g-yog gis tshol du gzhug go zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If it does not exist, the nurse should look for it.

original: dge 'dun gyi sman dang nad pa rang gi sman med pa nyid yin na de'i tshe sman de nad g-yog gis yon bdag gzhan tshol du gzhug go zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi sman dang nad pa rang gi sman med pa nyid yin na de'i tshe sman de nad g-yog gis yon bdag gzhan tshol du gzhug go zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If the medicine of the Saṅgha and the medicine of the sick person are not available, then at that time the attendant should seek the medicine from another benefactor.

original: ma 'byor na dge 'dun gyis sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ma 'byor na dge 'dun gyis sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If it is not available, the Saṅgha should give it.

original: gal te nad g-yog gis yon bdag gzhan 'tshol du bcug kyang sman de ma 'byor na de'i tshe @69b dge 'dun gyi dkor las zong sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te nad g-yog gis yon bdag gzhan 'tshol du bcug kyang sman de ma 'byor na de'i tshe @69b dge 'dun gyi dkor las zong sbyin par bya'o //
translated: If the attendant has sought another benefactor, but the medicine is not available, then at that time the Saṅgha should give the price of the medicine from the Saṅgha’s property.

original: 'dir sman smos pa ni mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir sman smos pa ni mtshon pa ste /
translated: Here, the mention of medicine is an illustration.

original: dngos po gang gis nad pa'i nad zhi bar 'gyur bas brel bar gyur pa'i dngos po rang la yang mi bdog tshol du bcug na yang ma rnyed la /
analyzed: dngos po gang gis nad pa'i nad zhi bar 'gyur bas brel bar gyur pa'i dngos po rang la yang mi bdog tshol du bcug na yang ma rnyed la /
translated: If the sick person’s illness is cured by some object, but that object is not available to the sick person or to the attendant, even if they have sought it,

original: dge 'dun gyi la ni yod na dge 'dun du gyur pa'i dge slong dag gis de thams cad sbyin par bya'o ;
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi la ni yod na dge 'dun du gyur pa'i dge slong dag gis de thams cad sbyin par bya'o ;
translated: and if the Saṅgha has it, then all the monks who are part of the Saṅgha should give it.

original: / med na sangs rgyas kyi las sku la gsol ba man chad kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: / med na sangs rgyas kyi las sku la gsol ba man chad kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If the Saṅgha does not have it, then the Buddha’s property, from the robes on the Buddha’s body down, should be given.

original: dge 'dun gyi med na sangs rgyas kyi las sbyin par bya'o //🔽sku la gsol ba man chad kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni /🔽sku gzugs dang mchod rten la rgyan la sogs pa btags pa gang yin pa de dag gi bar yang sbyin par bya na /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi med na sangs rgyas kyi las sbyin par bya'o // sku la gsol ba man chad kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni / sku gzugs dang mchod rten la rgyan la sogs pa btags pa gang yin pa de dag gi bar yang sbyin par bya na /
translated: If there is no property of the Sangha, one should give from the property of the Buddha.🔽Even from the property of the Buddha, if there is no other means.🔽Even from the property of the Buddha, if there is no other means.🔽Even from the property of the Buddha, if there is no other means.

original: sangs rgyas kyi 'am dge 'dun gyi dkor gzhan lta las smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽'di skad bstan te /🔽gal te nad pa'i nad la phan pa rang gi rdzas la med na de'i tshe dge 'dun gyi las thams cad sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi 'am dge 'dun gyi dkor gzhan lta las smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // 'di skad bstan te / gal te nad pa'i nad la phan pa rang gi rdzas la med na de'i tshe dge 'dun gyi las thams cad sbyin par bya'o //
translated: Even from the property of the Buddha, if there is no other means.🔽Even from the property of the Buddha, if there is no other means.🔽Even from the property of the Buddha, if there is no other means.🔽Even from the property of the Buddha, if there is no other means.

original: de yang med na sangs rgyas kyi las thams cad sbyin par bya ste /🔽'di la 'gyod par mi bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de yang med na sangs rgyas kyi las thams cad sbyin par bya ste / 'di la 'gyod par mi bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: Even from the property of the Buddha, if there is no other means.🔽Even from the property of the Buddha, if there is no other means.🔽Even from the property of the Buddha, if there is no other means.🔽Even from the property of the Buddha, if there is no other means.🔽Even from the property of the Buddha, if there is no other means.

original: de'i phyir dge 'dun gyi las btung ba dang gdugs gdags pa la sogs pa'i mchod pa bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir dge 'dun gyi las btung ba dang gdugs gdags pa la sogs pa'i mchod pa bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Even from the property of the Buddha, if there is no other means.🔽Even from the property of the Buddha, if there is no other means.🔽Even from the property of the Buddha, if there is no other means.🔽Even from the property of the Buddha, if there is no other means.🔽Even from the property of the Buddha, if there is no other means.🔽Even from the property of the Buddha, if there is no other means.🔽Even from the property of the Buddha, if there is no other means.🔽Even from the property of the Buddha, if there is no other means.🔽Even from the property of the Buddha, if there is no other means.🔽Even from the property of the Buddha, if there is no other means.🔽Even from the property of the Buddha, if there is no other means.🔽Even from the property of the Buddha, if there is no other means.🔽Even from the property of the Buddha, if there is no other means.🔽Even from the property of the Buddha, if there is no other means.🔽Even from the property of the Buddha, if there is no other means.

original: nad pa de'i phyir gal te rang dang de'i 'khor gyis kyang byed mi nus na dge 'dun du gyur pa'i dge slong dag gis dge 'dun gyi dkor las dkon mchog gsum la btung ba dang gdugs gdags pa la sogs pa'i mchod pa bya ba'o //
analyzed: nad pa de'i phyir gal te rang dang de'i 'khor gyis kyang byed mi nus na dge 'dun du gyur pa'i dge slong dag gis dge 'dun gyi dkor las dkon mchog gsum la btung ba dang gdugs gdags pa la sogs pa'i mchod pa bya ba'o //
translated: If the patient and his retinue are unable to do so, then the monks who are members of the Sangha should make offerings to the Three Jewels from the property of the Sangha, such as by offering drinks and parasols.

original: de'i phyir ma 'byor na zhes smos pa dang sbyar te /
analyzed: de'i phyir ma 'byor na zhes smos pa dang sbyar te /
translated: If that is not available,

original: rang gi rdzas med na dge 'dun gyi dkor las mchod snyon la sogs pa bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi rdzas med na dge 'dun gyi dkor las mchod snyon la sogs pa bya ba'o //
translated: if one's own property is not available, then offerings and so on should be made from the property of the Sangha.

original: med na sangs rgyas kyi las so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: med na sangs rgyas kyi las so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If that is not available, then from the property of the Buddha.

original: dge 'dun gyi dkor med na sangs rgyas kyi dkor las thams cad bya ba'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi dkor med na sangs rgyas kyi dkor las thams cad bya ba'o //
translated: If the property of the Sangha is not available, then everything should be done from the property of the Buddha.

original: de gnyis kyis blangs pa des ma shi la 'byor pa yod na bsab pa nyid du bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de gnyis kyis blangs pa des ma shi la 'byor pa yod na bsab pa nyid du bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If the patient does not die because of that, and if he has property, he should repay it himself.

original: dge 'dun dang sangs rgyas de gnyis kyi dkor blangs pa bsab pa nyid du bya'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun dang sangs rgyas de gnyis kyi dkor blangs pa bsab pa nyid du bya'o //
translated: The property of both the Sangha and the Buddha should be repaid by him.

original: sus she na de'i phyir des zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: sus she na de'i phyir des zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: By whom? Therefore it is said, by him.

original: sngon na bar gyur pa des so //
analyzed: sngon na bar gyur pa des so //
translated: by that former one.

original: gang gi tshe zhe na ;
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhe na ;
translated: When?

original: de'i phyir ma shi la zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir ma shi la zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore he says: as long as he is not dead.

original: gal te ma shi na de'i tshe na'o //
analyzed: gal te ma shi na de'i tshe na'o //
translated: If he is not dead, then at that time.

original: ci zhig gis bsab ce na /
analyzed: ci zhig gis bsab ce na /
translated: By what is it to be made up?

original: de'i phyir 'byor pa yod na zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'byor pa yod na zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore he says: if there is the opportunity.

original: 'byor pa med na ma bsabs kyang nyes pa med de /
analyzed: 'byor pa med na ma bsabs kyang nyes pa med de /
translated: If there is no opportunity, there is no fault if it is not made up,

original: bsam pa dag pa'i phyir dang zhing chen po'i gnas skabs su spyad pa'i phyir ro //🔽nad g-yog @70a * //
analyzed: bsam pa dag pa'i phyir dang zhing chen po'i gnas skabs su spyad pa'i phyir ro // nad g-yog @70a * //
translated: because of the purity of the intention and because of the practice in the state of the great field.🔽The morality of nursing the sick

original: gi tshul khrims bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gi tshul khrims bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: is taught in order to show the morality of nursing the sick.

original: nad g-yog gis de la bsnyen bkur mi bya bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: nad g-yog gis de la bsnyen bkur mi bya bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: He says: the nurse should not fail to attend to him.

original: nad g-yog gis nad pa de la bsnyen bkur mi bya bar mi bya'i bsnyen bkur bya ba ste /
analyzed: nad g-yog gis nad pa de la bsnyen bkur mi bya bar mi bya'i bsnyen bkur bya ba ste /
translated: The nurse should not fail to attend to the sick person, but should attend to him.

original: nad g-yog legs par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nad g-yog legs par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is: the nurse should do well.

original: de'i tshig don dang ldan pa dang chos dang ldan pa bcag par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i tshig don dang ldan pa dang chos dang ldan pa bcag par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He should not contradict his words that are meaningful and in accord with the Dharma.

original: nad pa de'i tshig gi don dang ldan pa zhes bya ba 'cho ba la phan pa dang 'brel pa dang / chos dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la bsod nams la phan pa dang 'brel pa bcag par mi bya ste /
analyzed: nad pa de'i tshig gi don dang ldan pa zhes bya ba 'cho ba la phan pa dang 'brel pa dang / chos dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la bsod nams la phan pa dang 'brel pa bcag par mi bya ste /
translated: The phrase in accordance with the Dharma means that the attendant should not interrupt the patient's words that are related to and beneficial for merit.

original: nad g-yog gis 'da' bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: nad g-yog gis 'da' bar mi bya'o //
translated: The attendant should not interrupt the patient's words.

original: lhag par chags pa'i dngos po 'gugs na dgag par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lhag par chags pa'i dngos po 'gugs na dgag par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: If the patient requests an object that he is attached to, the attendant should not prevent him from taking it.

original: lhag par chags pa'i dngos po zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lhag par chags pa'i dngos po zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase an object to which he is attached refers to

original: zhen pa'i dngos po lhung bzed la sogs pa dag go //
analyzed: zhen pa'i dngos po lhung bzed la sogs pa dag go //
translated: a cherished object such as a begging-bowl, etc.

original: 'gugs nas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'gugs nas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase if the patient requests it means

original: nad g-yog la kho bo'i dngos po de khyer te shog shig ces len du 'chol na'o //
analyzed: nad g-yog la kho bo'i dngos po de khyer te shog shig ces len du 'chol na'o //
translated: if the patient asks the attendant to bring it to him.

original: dgag par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dgag par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase the attendant should not prevent him from taking it means

original: blangs te bstan par bya ba'o //
analyzed: blangs te bstan par bya ba'o //
translated: that the attendant should bring it to the patient.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is being taught:

original: gal te nad pas nad g-yog la lhung bzed la sogs pa'i dngos po de 'on cig ces 'gugs shing len du 'chol na /
analyzed: gal te nad pas nad g-yog la lhung bzed la sogs pa'i dngos po de 'on cig ces 'gugs shing len du 'chol na /
translated: If the patient requests the attendant, saying Bring me that begging-bowl, etc.,

original: de'i tshe nad g-yog gis mi dgag par sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i tshe nad g-yog gis mi dgag par sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: At that time, the attendant should give it without being stopped. This is the meaning.

original: mi gdam par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi gdam par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not give advice.

original: nad g-yog gis nad pa de la gdams ngag mi sbyin par mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: nad g-yog gis nad pa de la gdams ngag mi sbyin par mi bya ba'o //
translated: The attendant should not give advice to the patient.

original: de nad pas bzla bar shin tu mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de nad pas bzla bar shin tu mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The patient should not at all transgress it.

analyzed: gtsug lag khang dang dgon pa der de dag gi tshul khrims kyi tshul khrims de 'dzin du gzhug par bya zhing nges par sbyar bar yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should cause them to take up the morality of that monastery and the morality of that hermitage, and one should also apply oneself to them.

original: gtsug lag khang dang dgon pa'i gnas der gsar bu de dag gi tshul khrims 'jug pa gnas pa'i tshul khrims gtsug lag khang dang dgon pa'i tshul khrims kun spyod pa la sogs pa de 'dzin du gzhug par bya ba gsar bu rnams la go bar bya zhing nges
analyzed: gtsug lag khang dang dgon pa'i gnas der gsar bu de dag gi tshul khrims 'jug pa gnas pa'i tshul khrims gtsug lag khang dang dgon pa'i tshul khrims kun spyod pa la sogs pa de 'dzin du gzhug par bya ba gsar bu rnams la go bar bya zhing nges
translated: In that monastery and hermitage, one should cause those novices to take up the morality of the monastery and the morality of the hermitage, which is the morality of the conduct of living there, and one should make the novices understand and apply oneself to them.

original: par sbyar ba yang ngo zhes bya ba las tshul khrims de zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: par sbyar ba yang ngo zhes bya ba las tshul khrims de zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The meaning of “that morality” is to be supplied.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: tshul khrims de 'dzin du gzhug pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis gsar bu rnams tshul khrims de la nan tan bya ba la nges par sbyar bar yang bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims de 'dzin du gzhug pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis gsar bu rnams tshul khrims de la nan tan bya ba la nges par sbyar bar yang bya ba'o //
translated: Not only should they be made to observe that morality, but the elder of the Saṅgha should also definitely join the novices in earnestly practicing that morality.

original: glo bur du 'ongs pas na so sor brtags @72a * //🔽nas gnas mal gyi phyir gnyug mar gnas pa rnams la brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /🔽gang dag glo bur du lhags pa de dag gi nang nas dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gang yin pa'i gnas brtan glo bur du 'ongs pa des rang dang lhan cig tu glo bur du lhags pa rnams la so sor brtags pa bgrangs nas gnas mal thob par bya
analyzed: glo bur du 'ongs pas na so sor brtags @72a * // nas gnas mal gyi phyir gnyug mar gnas pa rnams la brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni / gang dag glo bur du lhags pa de dag gi nang nas dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gang yin pa'i gnas brtan glo bur du 'ongs pa des rang dang lhan cig tu glo bur du lhags pa rnams la so sor brtags pa bgrangs nas gnas mal thob par bya
translated: Since they have come as guests, they should be assigned to beds and seats in order of seniority.🔽The elder of the Saṅgha who has come as a guest should count the number of guests and announce it to the resident monks in order to obtain beds and seats.

original: ba'i phyir dge slong gnyug mar gnas pa rnams la brjod par bya ba'o //
analyzed: ba'i phyir dge slong gnyug mar gnas pa rnams la brjod par bya ba'o //
translated: From among those who have come as guests, the elder of the Saṅgha, who is the elder of the guests, should count the number of guests and announce it to the resident monks in order to obtain beds and seats.

original: 'gro bar chas pas ni phyogs dang 'dron pa dang gnas dang gnas mal dang / grogs na na mi dor ba nyid brtags nas 'phags par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /🔽dge slong 'gro bar chas pa rnams kyi nang na 'gro bar chas pa'i gnas brtan gang yin pa gnas brtan 'gro bar chas pa des ni phyogs la sogs pa brtags nas 'phags par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'gro bar chas pas ni phyogs dang 'dron pa dang gnas dang gnas mal dang / grogs na na mi dor ba nyid brtags nas 'phags par bya'o zhes bya ba ni / dge slong 'gro bar chas pa rnams kyi nang na 'gro bar chas pa'i gnas brtan gang yin pa gnas brtan 'gro bar chas pa des ni phyogs la sogs pa brtags nas 'phags par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: One who is setting out should go after examining the direction, the caravan, the place, the bedding, and the companions.🔽The elder who is setting out should go after examining the direction, etc.

original: 'gro bar chas pa'i gnas brtan des phyogs gang du 'dron pa gang dang lam gang nas 'gro bar bya ba dang / gnas dgon pa la sogs pa 'dod pa gang yin pa dang / der son pa rnams kyi gnas mal gang yin pa de dag thams cad khong du chud par byas brtags nas grogs kyang brtags te /
analyzed: 'gro bar chas pa'i gnas brtan des phyogs gang du 'dron pa gang dang lam gang nas 'gro bar bya ba dang / gnas dgon pa la sogs pa 'dod pa gang yin pa dang / der son pa rnams kyi gnas mal gang yin pa de dag thams cad khong du chud par byas brtags nas grogs kyang brtags te /
translated: The elder who is setting out should understand all of these: the direction in which he is going, the caravan with which he is going, the path by which he is going, the place, such as a forest, which he desires, and the bedding of those who have gone there.

original: na bar gyur na gang gis kyang 'ga' yang mi 'dor ba nyid brtags nas de ltar yid la byas te ji ltar bsams pa'i gnas der son par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: na bar gyur na gang gis kyang 'ga' yang mi 'dor ba nyid brtags nas de ltar yid la byas te ji ltar bsams pa'i gnas der son par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: When one is sick, one should reflect on the fact that no one should be left out, and then, having attended to that, one should go to the place where one is to stay, as one has thought about it.

original: 'phags par bya'i gzhan du na mi 'phags so zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'phags par bya'i gzhan du na mi 'phags so zhes bya ba ste /
translated: One should go to the noble ones, not to others.

original: 'dir mdo'i don ni de yin no //
analyzed: 'dir mdo'i don ni de yin no //
translated: This is the meaning of the sutra here.

original: ring por ma son par thams cad kyi tha mar la la'i chung zad ma lus sam zhes 'phral du dran par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ring por ma son par thams cad kyi tha mar la la'i chung zad ma lus sam zhes 'phral du dran par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should immediately remember, Has anyone left anything behind? at the very end, when one has not gone far.

original: 'gro bar chas pa'i dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan des 'gro bar chas pa'i dge slong de dag la 'phral du dran par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'gro bar chas pa'i dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan des 'gro bar chas pa'i dge slong de dag la 'phral du dran par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The elder of the departing Sangha should immediately remember those departing monks.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How?

original: ring por ma son par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: ring por ma son par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: He says, When one has not gone far, etc.

original: gnas de nas thag ring por ma song bar zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gnas de nas thag ring por ma song bar zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

original: thams cad kyi tha mar zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: thams cad kyi tha mar zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: gzhi nas cha ba la sogs pa'i bya ba thams cad zin te /

original: gnas nas spags pa'i 'og tu'o //🔽la la'i zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gnas nas spags pa'i 'og tu'o // la la'i zhes bya ba ni /
translated: are completed.🔽After that, the elder should go out from the monastery.

original: dge slong la la'i'o //
analyzed: dge slong la la'i'o //

analyzed: cung zad ces bya ba ni dngos po'o // ma lus sam zhes bya ba ni /

original: ma brjed dam zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ma brjed dam zhes bya ba'o //

original: 'phral du dran par bya'o zhes bya ba ni mod la rma bas so //
analyzed: 'phral du dran par bya'o zhes bya ba ni mod la rma bas so //
translated: “Immediately” means at that time.

original: gsar bu rnams mi rgod @72b pa nyid dang ma khengs pa nyid la dgod par bya'o zhes bya ba la rgod pa ni nye bar ma zhi ba'o //
analyzed: gsar bu rnams mi rgod @72b pa nyid dang ma khengs pa nyid la dgod par bya'o zhes bya ba la rgod pa ni nye bar ma zhi ba'o //
translated: “The new monks should be placed in a state of non-agitation and non-arrogance.” Agitation is non-pacification.

original: khengs pa ni gyang gying che ba ste /
analyzed: khengs pa ni gyang gying che ba ste /
translated: Arrogance is haughtiness.

original: 'gro bar chas pa'i gnas brtan gyis gsar bu rnams de las bzlog par bya zhing /
analyzed: 'gro bar chas pa'i gnas brtan gyis gsar bu rnams de las bzlog par bya zhing /
translated: The elder who is about to go out should place the new monks in the opposite of that,

original: nye bar zhi ba dang / rgyags pa dang / nga rgyal nges par bcom pa nyid la dgod par bya'o ;
analyzed: nye bar zhi ba dang / rgyags pa dang / nga rgyal nges par bcom pa nyid la dgod par bya'o ;
translated: in a state of pacification and the destruction of conceit and pride.

analyzed: / khyim phyir nye ba na thams cad kyis thams cad kyang ngo zhes bya ba la /
translated: “When near the house, all should do all.”

original: khyim phyir nye ba na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khyim phyir nye ba na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Approaching the village means

original: grong du son pa na'o //
analyzed: grong du son pa na'o //
translated: having arrived at the village.

original: thams cad kyis zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: thams cad kyis zhes bya ba ni /
translated: All means

analyzed: 'gro bar chas pa'i gnas brtan 'ba' zhig ma yin gyi gnas brtan gzhan thams cad kyis kyang ngo //

analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba ni / gsar bu rnams 'ba' zhig ma yin gyi /

analyzed: rgan pa gzhan thams cad kyang ngo //
translated: not only the novices, but all the other elders as well.

original: kyang ngo zhes bya ba las ni /
analyzed: kyang ngo zhes bya ba las ni /
translated: Also means

analyzed: mi rgod pa nyid dang ma khengs pa nyid la dgod par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //

original: kun shes par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: kun shes par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should know all means

analyzed: 'gro bar chas pa'i dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis rang gi 'khor ming la sogs pa'i mtshan mas kun shes par bya ba ste /

analyzed: 'di ni bdag gi 'khor du gtogs pa'i gang zag go //

analyzed: de yang bdag gis bsrung bar bya ba'o zhes bya ba'i don du'o //
translated: And he is to be protected by me. This is the meaning.

translated: One should benefit them by performing services such as teaching them proper conduct and behavior, instructing them in the scriptures, etc., and by providing them with the requisites of food, clothing, etc., and by sharing one's own food with the sick, etc.

analyzed: bsod snyoms la sogs pa'i spyod yul lo // spyod lam zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Proper conduct is the domain of alms-begging, etc.

analyzed: 'chag pa la sogs pa'i spyod lam mo // bstan pa zhes bya ba ni /

original: de gnyis bstan pa ste /🔽'di ni spyod yul lo //
analyzed: de gnyis bstan pa ste / 'di ni spyod yul lo //

analyzed: 'di ni spyod yul ma yin no // 'di ltar 'gro bar bya'o //

analyzed: 'di ltar 'gro bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa'o // lung mnod pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: One should go in this way, one should not go in that way, etc.🔽Instructing is the instruction in the scriptures, etc.🔽Etc.

analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni kha ton la sogs pa dag bsdu'o // zas kyi rnyed pa zhes bya ba ni /

original: bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa'o //

original: nad pa la bgo bsha' bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nad pa la bgo bsha' bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase to distribute to the sick, and so on, means

analyzed: nad pa la bog bsha' bya ba ni sman dang nad g-yog la sogs pa'o //
translated: to distribute medicine, nursing, and so on to the sick.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni /
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni /
translated: The phrase and so on means

analyzed: chos gos la sogs pa zang zing gi bgo bsha' dag bsdu'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: to distribute material goods, such as robes, and so on.

original: spyod pa dang @73a * //
analyzed: spyod pa dang @73a * //
translated: The phrase to do these things means

original: spyod lam bstan pa dang / lung mnod pa la sogs pa dang / zas kyi rnyed pa dang / nad pa la bgo bsha' bya ba la sogs pa de dag nyid bya ba'o //
analyzed: spyod lam bstan pa dang / lung mnod pa la sogs pa dang / zas kyi rnyed pa dang / nad pa la bgo bsha' bya ba la sogs pa de dag nyid bya ba'o //
translated: to teach proper conduct and deportment, to give oral instructions, to distribute food, and to distribute to the sick, and so on.🔽The phrase by accomplishing these means

original: de dag bsgrubs pas zhes bya ba ni nan tan bya bas so //
analyzed: de dag bsgrubs pas zhes bya ba ni nan tan bya bas so //
translated: by practicing them.

original: phan gdags par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: phan gdags par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase to benefit them means

original: dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis de dag gi gsar bu rnams la phan gdags par bya'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis de dag gi gsar bu rnams la phan gdags par bya'o //
translated: that the elder of the saṅgha should benefit their novices.🔽The phrase having agreed not to sweep the monastery means

original: dbyar gnas par khas blangs pas gtsug lag khang gi byi dor mi byed pa la gros btab ste /
analyzed: dbyar gnas par khas blangs pas gtsug lag khang gi byi dor mi byed pa la gros btab ste /
translated: that the monks who have undertaken the rainy season retreat should not sweep the monastery.

original: byi dor byed du gzhug cing byi dor byed pa la ni spro bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: byi dor byed du gzhug cing byi dor byed pa la ni spro bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /

original: dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa'i gnas brtan gyis gtsug lag khang gi byi dor byed du gzhug go zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa'i gnas brtan gyis gtsug lag khang gi byi dor byed du gzhug go zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: This is connected with the elder who has accepted the rainy season, who should clean the temple.

original: gtsug lag khang gi byi dor mi byed pa la gros btab ste /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang gi byi dor mi byed pa la gros btab ste /
translated: He should advise those who are not cleaning the temple.

original: byi dor byed du gzhug ces bya ba 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: byi dor byed du gzhug ces bya ba 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is taught:

original: gal te dge slong rang dgar dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa dag gtsug lag khang gi byi dor mi byed na de'i tshe dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis ci nas kyang gtsug lag khang gi byi dor byed par 'gyur ba de ltar gros btab spro bar byas te
analyzed: gal te dge slong rang dgar dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa dag gtsug lag khang gi byi dor mi byed na de'i tshe dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis ci nas kyang gtsug lag khang gi byi dor byed par 'gyur ba de ltar gros btab spro bar byas te
translated: If monks who have accepted the rainy season at will do not clean the temple, then the elder of the saṅgha should advise them in such a way that the temple will be cleaned.

original: / byi dor byed du gzhug pa'o //
analyzed: / byi dor byed du gzhug pa'o //

original: gang gi tshe rang gi ngang kho nas byi dor byed na de'i tshe ji ltar bya zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rang gi ngang kho nas byi dor byed na de'i tshe ji ltar bya zhe na /

analyzed: de'i phyir byi dor byed pa la ni spro bar bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, one should be enthusiastic about cleaning.

analyzed: bya ba de ni tshul dang mthun pa yin no zhes gzengs bstod pas spro bar bya ba'o //
translated: One should be enthusiastic by praising the propriety of that action.

original: thams cad kyis 'khor du gtogs pa gtam 'dod pa dag la rjes su mthun pa'i chos nye bar bsgrub pas phan gdags par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: thams cad kyis 'khor du gtogs pa gtam 'dod pa dag la rjes su mthun pa'i chos nye bar bsgrub pas phan gdags par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: All should benefit those who are members of the assembly and desire instruction by providing them with the Dharma in an appropriate manner.

original: gnas brtan thams cad kyis dge slong 'khor du gtogs pa la chos kyis phan gdags par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gnas brtan thams cad kyis dge slong 'khor du gtogs pa la chos kyis phan gdags par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: This means that all elders should benefit the monks who are members of the assembly by means of the Dharma.🔽All means

original: thams cad kyis zhes bya ba ni /🔽gnas brtan thams cad kyis te /
analyzed: thams cad kyis zhes bya ba ni / gnas brtan thams cad kyis te /
translated: all elders.

original: dbyar gnas pa'i gnas brtan 'ba' zhig gis bya bar ma zad pa'o //
analyzed: dbyar gnas pa'i gnas brtan 'ba' zhig gis bya bar ma zad pa'o //
translated: This is not only the duty of the elder who resides during the rains.

original: gang gi tshe zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhe na /
translated: When?

original: 'khor du gtogs pa gtam 'dod pa dag gi tshe ste /
analyzed: 'khor du gtogs pa gtam 'dod pa dag gi tshe ste /
translated: When those who are members of the assembly desire instruction.

original: gal te dge slong de dag mdo sde dang 'dul ba la sogs pa'i chos kyi gtam 'dod cing gsol ba'i tshe'o //
analyzed: gal te dge slong de dag mdo sde dang 'dul ba la sogs pa'i chos kyi gtam 'dod cing gsol ba'i tshe'o //
translated: If those monks desire and request instruction on the sūtras, the vinaya, and so on.

original: de'i tshe de dag la dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan thams cad kyis gang la gang 'os pa'i rjes su mthun pa'i chos nye bar bsgrub pa des phan gdags par bya ba'o /🔽// / bam po bdun pa /
analyzed: de'i tshe de dag la dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan thams cad kyis gang la gang 'os pa'i rjes su mthun pa'i chos nye bar bsgrub pa des phan gdags par bya ba'o / // / bam po bdun pa /
translated: At that time, the elder of the Saṅgha should help them by providing whatever is suitable and appropriate.
