analyzed: mi smra ba nyid la dga' ba dag btang snyoms su @73b gzhag go zhes bya ba la mi smra ba'i dngos po ni /
translated: Those who delight in silence should be left alone.

original: mi smra ba nyid do //
analyzed: mi smra ba nyid do //
translated: The state of silence is silence itself.

original: gang dag de la dga' ba'i dge slong dag ci dgar btang snyoms su gzhag go //
analyzed: gang dag de la dga' ba'i dge slong dag ci dgar btang snyoms su gzhag go //
translated: Those monks who delight in that should be left alone as they wish.

original: 'dir mi smra ba nyid ces bya ba yang 'phags pa'i mi smra ba nyid tshul bzhin yid la byed pa zhes bya ba nyid yin par 'dod kyi /🔽gyi na kha rog ste 'dug pa la ni mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir mi smra ba nyid ces bya ba yang 'phags pa'i mi smra ba nyid tshul bzhin yid la byed pa zhes bya ba nyid yin par 'dod kyi / gyi na kha rog ste 'dug pa la ni mi bya'o //
translated: Here, silence is considered to be the noble silence of proper mental attention.🔽It should not be taken as just remaining silent and quiet.

original: khyim pa de nye bar 'ongs pa'i mtshal ma sbyor du gzhug go zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khyim pa de nye bar 'ongs pa'i mtshal ma sbyor du gzhug go zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The householder should be made to apply the dye.

original: gal te gtsug lag khang du khyim pa 'ongs na khyim pa nye bar 'ongs pa'i zan sbyor du gzhug go //
analyzed: gal te gtsug lag khang du khyim pa 'ongs na khyim pa nye bar 'ongs pa'i zan sbyor du gzhug go //
translated: If a householder comes to the monastery, he should be made to prepare a meal for those who have come to the house.

original: dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis dge slong dag la go bar bya ste /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis dge slong dag la go bar bya ste /
translated: The elder of the saṅgha should inform the monks:

original: zan sbyor du bcug pa na gal te dge slong dag sta gon mi byed dam khyim pa de dag zan mi 'dod na de'i tshe mi byed dam mi 'dod na de dag la chos dang ldan pa'i gtam byas nas bdag cag la 'di yod do zhes brjod par
analyzed: zan sbyor du bcug pa na gal te dge slong dag sta gon mi byed dam khyim pa de dag zan mi 'dod na de'i tshe mi byed dam mi 'dod na de dag la chos dang ldan pa'i gtam byas nas bdag cag la 'di yod do zhes brjod par
translated: “When you are made to prepare a meal, if the monks do not prepare it or if those householders do not want to eat, then at that time you should not do it. If they do not want it, after having a Dharma discussion with them, you should say, ‘We have this.’”

original: bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is what was said.

original: dge slong dag zan gyi sta gon mi byed dam khyim pa dag zan bza' bar mi 'dod na khyim pa de dag la dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis chos dang ldan pa sbyin pa la sogs pa'i gtam bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag zan gyi sta gon mi byed dam khyim pa dag zan bza' bar mi 'dod na khyim pa de dag la dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis chos dang ldan pa sbyin pa la sogs pa'i gtam bya'o //
translated: If the monks do not prepare the meal or if the householders do not want to eat, then the elder of the saṅgha should have a Dharma discussion with those householders about generosity and so forth.

original: de dag byas nas dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis de dag yang dag par dga' bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag byas nas dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis de dag yang dag par dga' bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: After they have done that, the elder of the saṅgha should have a Dharma discussion with them in order to delight them.

original: bdag cag dge slong rnams la chos kyi sbyin pa 'di yod do zhes de dag la brjod par bya ba'o //
analyzed: bdag cag dge slong rnams la chos kyi sbyin pa 'di yod do zhes de dag la brjod par bya ba'o //
translated: We monks have this gift of the Dharma.

original: de dag dang ldan pa thams cad kyis 'khor la so sor brtag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'khor de dang ldan pa'i dge slong thams cad kyis kyang rang rang gi 'khor la so sor brtag par bya'i dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan 'ba' zhig gis bya bar ma
analyzed: de dag dang ldan pa thams cad kyis 'khor la so sor brtag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'khor de dang ldan pa'i dge slong thams cad kyis kyang rang rang gi 'khor la so sor brtag par bya'i dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan 'ba' zhig gis bya bar ma
translated: And all who are in the assembly should examine the assembly. This means that all the monks who are in that assembly should examine their own assembly, and not just the elder of the Saṅgha.

original: zad do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zad do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is what it means to say not only...

original: don med par spyod pa tshar gcod do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: don med par spyod pa tshar gcod do zhes bya ba la /
translated: One should restrain those who engage in meaningless activities.

original: gang mi dgos pa byed pa de ni don med par spyod pa ste /
analyzed: gang mi dgos pa byed pa de ni don med par spyod pa ste /
translated: Here, meaningless activities refers to those who do what is not necessary.

original: ci nas kyang don med pas dus yol bar byed par mi 'gyur ba de ltar tshar gcad par bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci nas kyang don med pas dus yol bar byed par mi 'gyur ba de ltar tshar gcad par bya ba'o //
translated: One should restrain them so that they do not waste time with what is meaningless.

original: de la 'gro ba la sogs pa de ji ltar ba bzhin bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la 'gro ba la sogs pa de ji ltar ba bzhin bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: In that regard, one should act according to the circumstances with regard to going and so on.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Here, in that regard refers to

original: 'khor la'o // 'gro ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'khor la'o // 'gro ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: the assembly. Going and so on refers to🔽 going, staying, sitting, and lying down.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni /
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni /
translated: refers to the following:

original: 'di ltar 'gro bar bya /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'gro bar bya /
translated: “One should go in this way.

original: 'di ltar 'dug par bya /🔽'di ltar nyal bar bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa de lta bu dag gi don du 'khor ji lta ba bzhin bya ba bsdu'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dug par bya / 'di ltar nyal bar bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa de lta bu dag gi don du 'khor ji lta ba bzhin bya ba bsdu'o //
translated: One should sit in this way.🔽One should sleep in this way.”

original: de zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'khor la snyegs so //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'khor la snyegs so //
translated: The word “one” refers to the retinue.

original: ji lta ba bzhin zhes bya ba @74a * //
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin zhes bya ba @74a * //
translated: “In this way”

original: ni ; 'khor dang mthun par bya'o //
analyzed: ni ; 'khor dang mthun par bya'o //
translated: means “in accordance with the retinue.”

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: 'khor dang ldan pa'i dge slong gis 'gro ba la sogs pa rang gi 'khor dang mthun par bya ste /
analyzed: 'khor dang ldan pa'i dge slong gis 'gro ba la sogs pa rang gi 'khor dang mthun par bya ste /
translated: A monk who has a retinue should go, etc., in accordance with his retinue.

original: 'khor dang ldan pa des rang gi 'khor rnams kyi 'gro ba la sogs pa 'khor ji lta ba bzhin bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'khor dang ldan pa des rang gi 'khor rnams kyi 'gro ba la sogs pa 'khor ji lta ba bzhin bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: That one who has a retinue should accomplish the going, etc. of his retinue in accordance with the retinue. This is the meaning.

original: gtam sna tshogs dang 'gal ba med par bya'o zhes bya ba la /🔽gtam sna tshogs zhes bya ba ni /🔽rnam par 'phros pa'i gtam mo //
analyzed: gtam sna tshogs dang 'gal ba med par bya'o zhes bya ba la / gtam sna tshogs zhes bya ba ni / rnam par 'phros pa'i gtam mo //
translated: “One should not contradict the various conversations.”🔽The various conversations🔽are the conversations that are spread out.

original: gtam 'gal ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gtam 'gal ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Contradictory conversations🔽are those that are not in accordance with the Dharma.

original: chos 'dul ba dang 'gal ba'o //
analyzed: chos 'dul ba dang 'gal ba'o //
translated: and it is contrary to the Dharma and Vinaya.

original: 'khor dang ldan pa gang la gtam sna tshogs dang gtam 'gal ba med pa de ni gtam sna tshogs dang 'gal ba med pa ste /
analyzed: 'khor dang ldan pa gang la gtam sna tshogs dang gtam 'gal ba med pa de ni gtam sna tshogs dang 'gal ba med pa ste /
translated: The assembly that is endowed with the various kinds of speech and the absence of contrary speech is the assembly that has various kinds of speech and the absence of contrary speech.🔽That assembly should be endowed with that kind of distinction.

original: 'khor dang ldan pa des 'khor de la khyad par de lta bu dang ldan par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'khor dang ldan pa des 'khor de la khyad par de lta bu dang ldan par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: gnas dang gnas pa'i skabs yin pa'i phyir de'i zhar la /
analyzed: gnas dang gnas pa'i skabs yin pa'i phyir de'i zhar la /
translated: Because this is the section on the proper and improper,

original: phyi bzhin 'brang ba'i dge sbyong mdun du 'gro bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba 'di smras te /
analyzed: phyi bzhin 'brang ba'i dge sbyong mdun du 'gro bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba 'di smras te /
translated: it is said that a following śramaṇa should not go in front.

original: phyi bzhin 'brang ba'i dge sbyong gnas kyi mdun du 'gro bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: phyi bzhin 'brang ba'i dge sbyong gnas kyi mdun du 'gro bar mi bya'o //
translated: A following śramaṇa should not go in front of the proper.

original: 'dug par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dug par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is said, One should not sit.

original: gong du 'dug pa dang 'greng bar mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: gong du 'dug pa dang 'greng bar mi bya ba'o //
translated: One should not sit or stand above.

original: smras na smra bar bya zhing bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: smras na smra bar bya zhing bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: If spoken, one should speak and accomplish.

original: smras na smra bar bya zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: smras na smra bar bya zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If spoken, one should speak means

original: dge slong bal mas smras shing brjod na /
analyzed: dge slong bal mas smras shing brjod na /
translated: if a bhikṣu speaks and expresses

original: phyi bzhin 'brang ba'i dge sbyong gis smra bar bya ba ste /
analyzed: phyi bzhin 'brang ba'i dge sbyong gis smra bar bya ba ste /
translated: The novice monk who is following behind should speak.

original: bal mas ma smras kyi bar du 'og mas cung zad kyang smra bar mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: bal mas ma smras kyi bar du 'og mas cung zad kyang smra bar mi bya ba'o //
translated: Until the one above him has spoken, the one below him should not speak at all.

original: bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “He should do what he is told” means

original: yang na dge sbyong bla mas gang smras pa de phyi bzhin 'brang ba'i dge sbyong gis cang mi smra ba kho nar bsgrub par bya ba'o //🔽gtam gyi bar chad mi bya'o zhes bya ba la ;
analyzed: yang na dge sbyong bla mas gang smras pa de phyi bzhin 'brang ba'i dge sbyong gis cang mi smra ba kho nar bsgrub par bya ba'o // gtam gyi bar chad mi bya'o zhes bya ba la ;
translated: that the novice monk who is following behind should do exactly what the novice monk who is his superior tells him to do, without saying a word.🔽“He should not interrupt his conversation” means

original: gtam gyi bar chad ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: gtam gyi bar chad ces bya ba ni /
translated: that “interrupting a conversation”

original: gtam zer ba'i bar du gcod pa'o //
analyzed: gtam zer ba'i bar du gcod pa'o //
translated: means to interrupt someone who is speaking.

original: dge sbyong bla mas gtam zer ba na phyi bzhin 'brang ba'i dge sbyong gis gtam gyi bar chad mi bya'o //
analyzed: dge sbyong bla mas gtam zer ba na phyi bzhin 'brang ba'i dge sbyong gis gtam gyi bar chad mi bya'o //
translated: When the novice monk who is his superior is speaking, the novice monk who is following behind should not interrupt his conversation.

original: chos ma yin pa smra ba na bzlog par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos ma yin pa smra ba na bzlog par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “When he is speaking unrighteously, he should be stopped” means

original: dge sbyong bla ma chos ma yin pa mi rigs pa smra ba na phyi bzhin 'brang ba'i dge slong gis bzlog par bya dgag par bya'o //
analyzed: dge sbyong bla ma chos ma yin pa mi rigs pa smra ba na phyi bzhin 'brang ba'i dge slong gis bzlog par bya dgag par bya'o //
translated: that when the novice monk who is his superior is speaking unrighteously and unsuitably, the novice monk who is following behind should stop him and should prevent him from doing so.

original: chos kyis rjes su yi rang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos kyis rjes su yi rang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should rejoice in the Dharma.

original: dge slong bla ma la sogs pa chos smra ba na phyi bzhin 'brang ba'i dge sbyong la sogs pas rjes su yi rang bar bya ste /
analyzed: dge slong bla ma la sogs pa chos smra ba na phyi bzhin 'brang ba'i dge sbyong la sogs pas rjes su yi rang bar bya ste /
translated: When a superior monk, etc., who teaches the Dharma, is followed by a śramaṇa disciple, etc., he should rejoice.

original: legs so zhes bya ba sbyin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: legs so zhes bya ba sbyin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that he should give the word “good.

original: chos dang ldan pa'i rnyed pa byung na @74b blang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos dang ldan pa'i rnyed pa byung na @74b blang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: When one obtains goods in accordance with the Dharma, one should accept them.

original: dge sbyong bla ma'i chos dang ldan pa'i rnyed pa zhig byung na phyi bzhin 'brang ba'i dge sbyong gis blang bar bya ste /
analyzed: dge sbyong bla ma'i chos dang ldan pa'i rnyed pa zhig byung na phyi bzhin 'brang ba'i dge sbyong gis blang bar bya ste /
translated: When a superior śramaṇa obtains goods in accordance with the Dharma, a śramaṇa disciple who follows him should accept them.

original: dge sbyong bla ma rang gis blang ba ni tshul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge sbyong bla ma rang gis blang ba ni tshul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is improper for the superior śramaṇa to accept them himself.

original: de ni phyi bzhin 'brang ba'i dge sbyong gi tshul khrims yin no //
analyzed: de ni phyi bzhin 'brang ba'i dge sbyong gi tshul khrims yin no //
translated: This is the morality of a śramaṇa disciple who follows.

original: 'di man chad ni rab tu byung ba'i gzhi'i zhar la phran tshegs la sogs pa'i skabs nas 'byung ba shes par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di man chad ni rab tu byung ba'i gzhi'i zhar la phran tshegs la sogs pa'i skabs nas 'byung ba shes par bya ste /
translated: From here on, the remaining matters should be understood from the Kṣudraka Collection, etc., in the context of the foundation of the renunciant life.

original: de la je re zhig khyim du 'gro ba'i tshul khrims brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de la je re zhig khyim du 'gro ba'i tshul khrims brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, first of all, the morality of going to a house will be discussed.

original: khyim du mi rgod pa dang ma khengs pa dang mi gnas par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khyim du mi rgod pa dang ma khengs pa dang mi gnas par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not be greedy, arrogant, or attached in a house.

original: dge sbyong khyim du 'gro bas khyim du mi rgod par bya ba dang / ma khengs pa ni gyang gying med par bya ba dang / mi gnas pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge sbyong khyim du 'gro bas khyim du mi rgod par bya ba dang / ma khengs pa ni gyang gying med par bya ba dang / mi gnas pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: A religious wanderer who goes to a house should not be greedy in a house, should not be arrogant, should not be without shame, and should not be attached.

original: dge sbyong khyim du 'gro bas khyim du mi gnas par byas te /
analyzed: dge sbyong khyim du 'gro bas khyim du mi gnas par byas te /
translated: A religious wanderer who goes to a house should not be attached to a house.

original: khyim nas phyir 'gro 'dod par bya zhing der yun ring du gnas pa'i sems med par bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyim nas phyir 'gro 'dod par bya zhing der yun ring du gnas pa'i sems med par bya ba'o //
translated: He should wish to go out from the house, and should not have a mind that stays there for a long time.

original: mig smad pa dang khyim pa rnams la chos dang ldan pa'i gtam bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mig smad pa dang khyim pa rnams la chos dang ldan pa'i gtam bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: One should look down at the ground, and one should speak Dharma to householders.

original: gang gis mig smad pa de ni mig smad pa ste /
analyzed: gang gis mig smad pa de ni mig smad pa ste /
translated: One who looks down at the ground is one who looks down at the ground.

original: yul rnams las mig phyir blan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yul rnams las mig phyir blan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that one turns the eyes away from objects.

original: g-yeng bag tu lta ba nyid ni tshul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: g-yeng bag tu lta ba nyid ni tshul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because looking with distraction is not the proper way.

original: chos dang ldan pa'i gtam bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos dang ldan pa'i gtam bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should converse with them about the Dharma.

original: khyim du son pa na khyim pa rnams la chos dang ldan pa'i gtam bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: khyim du son pa na khyim pa rnams la chos dang ldan pa'i gtam bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that when one has gone to the house, one should converse with the householders about the Dharma.

original: ci dang ci lta bu bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci dang ci lta bu bya zhe na /
translated: What should one do?

original: de'i phyir sbyin pa dang dul ba dang yang dag par sdom pa dang / tshangs par spyod pa la gnas pa dang / gso sbyong dang skyabs su 'gro ba dang / bslab pa'i gzhi bzung bdag la de dag nges par sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sbyin pa dang dul ba dang yang dag par sdom pa dang / tshangs par spyod pa la gnas pa dang / gso sbyong dang skyabs su 'gro ba dang / bslab pa'i gzhi bzung bdag la de dag nges par sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said: “One should definitely engage them in giving, self-control, restraint, living the holy life, the purification of the fast, going for refuge, and taking up the precepts.”

original: dge slong khyim du 'gro bas khyim pa de dag sbyin pa la sogs pa dag la nges par sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: dge slong khyim du 'gro bas khyim pa de dag sbyin pa la sogs pa dag la nges par sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: A monk who goes to the house should definitely engage those householders in giving, etc.

original: de la sbyin pa zhes bya ba ni gang gis sbyin par byed pa dang sbyin par bya pa'o //
analyzed: de la sbyin pa zhes bya ba ni gang gis sbyin par byed pa dang sbyin par bya pa'o //
translated: There, “giving” is that by which one gives and that which is given.

original: dul ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dul ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Self-control” is

original: dbang po rnams la dbang byed pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po rnams la dbang byed pa'o //
translated: the control of the faculties.

original: yang dag par sdom pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yang dag par sdom pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Correct restraint” means

original: lus dang ngag gi yang dag par sdom pa'o //
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi yang dag par sdom pa'o //
translated: restraint of body and speech.

original: tshangs par spyod pa la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Dwelling in pure conduct” means

original: rab tu byung ba'i tshul khrims dang khyim pa nyid la yang ji srid 'tsho'i bar du grong pa'i chos las phyir ldog pa'o //🔽ltung ba'i sgor gyur pa'i 'jug pa thams cad la dran pas bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /🔽'jug pa thams cad la dran bas @75a * //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba'i tshul khrims dang khyim pa nyid la yang ji srid 'tsho'i bar du grong pa'i chos las phyir ldog pa'o // ltung ba'i sgor gyur pa'i 'jug pa thams cad la dran pas bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba ni / 'jug pa thams cad la dran bas @75a * //
translated: the morality of one who has gone forth, or even for a layperson, turning away from the activities of the village for as long as one lives.🔽“One should practice mindfulness with regard to all occasions that are doors to downfalls” means

original: bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: that one should practice mindfulness with regard to all occasions.

original: khyad par ji lta bu can zhig ce na /
analyzed: khyad par ji lta bu can zhig ce na /
translated: What kind of distinction?

original: ltung ba'i sgor gyur pa la ste /
analyzed: ltung ba'i sgor gyur pa la ste /
translated: With regard to those that are doors to downfalls.

original: bya ba brtsam pa gang las ltung ba 'byung bar 'gyur ba yod pa ltung ba 'byung ba'i sgor gyur pa de la'o //
analyzed: bya ba brtsam pa gang las ltung ba 'byung bar 'gyur ba yod pa ltung ba 'byung ba'i sgor gyur pa de la'o //
translated: With regard to those that are doors to downfalls, that is, with regard to those occasions that are the beginning of an action from which a downfall might occur.

original: khyim du 'jug pa dang bsod snyoms blang ba la sogs pa dang 'gro ba dang 'jug pa dang / lhung bzed bzed pa la sogs pa'i 'jug pa thams cad la dran pas bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: khyim du 'jug pa dang bsod snyoms blang ba la sogs pa dang 'gro ba dang 'jug pa dang / lhung bzed bzed pa la sogs pa'i 'jug pa thams cad la dran pas bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: One should practice with mindfulness in all activities, such as entering the house, taking alms, and so on, and in all activities such as going, entering, holding the alms bowl, and so on.

original: dge slong dran pa mngon du gyur pas bya ba de dag la 'jug par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dge slong dran pa mngon du gyur pas bya ba de dag la 'jug par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the monk should engage in those activities with manifest mindfulness.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is taught:

original: gal te dge slong bya ba rtsom par 'dod pas bya ba brtsam pa gang las ltung ba 'byung ba yod pa'i ltung ba'i yul de la dge slong des ci nas kyang ltung ba 'ga' yang mi 'byung ba de ltar dang po nyid nas dran pa nye bar gzhag🔽par bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te dge slong bya ba rtsom par 'dod pas bya ba brtsam pa gang las ltung ba 'byung ba yod pa'i ltung ba'i yul de la dge slong des ci nas kyang ltung ba 'ga' yang mi 'byung ba de ltar dang po nyid nas dran pa nye bar gzhag par bya ba yin gyi /
translated: If a monk wishes to begin an activity, he should first establish mindfulness with regard to the object of the downfall, that is, the activity from which a downfall may occur, so that no downfall occurs at all.

original: don gyi rang gi ngo bo nyid nges par bzung ba'i phyir dran pas bsgrub par bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don gyi rang gi ngo bo nyid nges par bzung ba'i phyir dran pas bsgrub par bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that one should practice with mindfulness in order to ascertain the intrinsic nature of the object.

original: rjes su 'gro ba bslabs pas mi bya bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba bslabs pas mi bya bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not do what is not to be done through training in following.

original: bsgrub par zhes bya bar sbyar ro //🔽rjes su 'gro bas ni rjes su 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: bsgrub par zhes bya bar sbyar ro // rjes su 'gro bas ni rjes su 'gro ba ste /
translated: The phrase “should be accomplished” is to be supplied.🔽“Following” means to follow after.

original: rjes su 'brang ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su 'brang ba'o //
translated: “To follow” means to pursue.

original: gang la rjes su 'brang ba des gal te bslabs par gyur na de ni des bslabs pa yin pas rjes su 'gro ba des de'i rjes su bstan pa las mi 'da' bar bsgrub par bya ba de mi bya ba'o ;
analyzed: gang la rjes su 'brang ba des gal te bslabs par gyur na de ni des bslabs pa yin pas rjes su 'gro ba des de'i rjes su bstan pa las mi 'da' bar bsgrub par bya ba de mi bya ba'o ;
translated: If one who is following after someone else trains in that, then that one is trained by that one. Therefore, one should not transgress the training that is taught by that one’s following.

original: /'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: /'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: gang zag gang gang zag gang gi rjes su 'brang zhing gal te des de slob tu 'jug par byed na /
analyzed: gang zag gang gang zag gang gi rjes su 'brang zhing gal te des de slob tu 'jug par byed na /
translated: If a person who is following after another person causes that one to train,

original: rjes su 'brang ba des de'i bslab pa khas blang bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rjes su 'brang ba des de'i bslab pa khas blang bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: then the one who is following after that one should accept that one’s training. This is the meaning.

original: 'ongs pa la 'ongs pa legs so zhes sngar snyan par brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni ;
analyzed: 'ongs pa la 'ongs pa legs so zhes sngar snyan par brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni ;
translated: “One should first say, ‘Welcome! Welcome!’ to one who has come.”

original: gal te khyim pa'am rab tu byung ba 'ga' zhig gtsug lag khang du 'ongs na 'ongs pa de la dge slong gis 'ongs pa legs so zhes brjod par bya zhing /
analyzed: gal te khyim pa'am rab tu byung ba 'ga' zhig gtsug lag khang du 'ongs na 'ongs pa de la dge slong gis 'ongs pa legs so zhes brjod par bya zhing /
translated: If a householder or a renunciant comes to the monastery, the monk should say to that person who has come, “Welcome!”

original: 'ongs pa gang yin pa des brjod pa bas sngar bsnyen par brjod par bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'ongs pa gang yin pa des brjod pa bas sngar bsnyen par brjod par bya ba'o //
translated: The one who has come should be addressed with the words of a venerable elder.

original: bzhin gyi mdangs gsal bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bzhin gyi mdangs gsal bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “One should have a clear complexion” means

original: bzhin rab tu dang bar bya zhing ngom zum mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: bzhin rab tu dang bar bya zhing ngom zum mi bya ba'o //
translated: one should have a clear face and not a sullen face.

original: 'dzum par sngar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dzum par sngar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “One should smile first” means

original: 'ongs pa de la dge slong des 'dzum pa yid tsam dgod par sngar bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'ongs pa de la dge slong des 'dzum pa yid tsam dgod par sngar bya ba'o //
translated: that monk should smile first and then speak to that person who has come.

original: khro gnyer med par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khro gnyer med par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “One should be free of frowns” means

original: gang la 'ongs pa na khro gnyer med pa de ni khro gnyer med pa ste de ltar bya ba @75b ba'o ;
analyzed: gang la 'ongs pa na khro gnyer med pa de ni khro gnyer med pa ste de ltar bya ba @75b ba'o ;
translated: that one should not frown when someone comes.

original: / gal te khyim pa zhig na de la chos dang ldan pa'i gtam bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: / gal te khyim pa zhig na de la chos dang ldan pa'i gtam bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “If it is a householder, one should speak to him with Dharma talk.”

original: gal te khyim pa zhig gtsug lag khang du 'ongs na khyim pa de la dge slong gis chos dang ldan pa'i gtam bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te khyim pa zhig gtsug lag khang du 'ongs na khyim pa de la dge slong gis chos dang ldan pa'i gtam bya ba'o //
translated: If a householder comes to the monastery, the monk should give him a Dharma talk.

original: grong mtha' bas ni der mi 'ong na kun dga' bar 'gyur bar ci nus pas bzlug par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: grong mtha' bas ni der mi 'ong na kun dga' bar 'gyur bar ci nus pas bzlug par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If the householder does not come to the monastery, the monk should invite him to come, to the best of his ability, in a way that will please him.

original: dge slong grong mtha' pa gtsug lag khang na gnas pas ni gtsug lag khang der khyim pa mi 'ong na de'i tshe kun dga' bar 'gyur ba zas dang skom la sogs pa ci nus pas nus pa dang mi 'gal bar nus pa'i mthu dang mthun par bzlug par
analyzed: dge slong grong mtha' pa gtsug lag khang na gnas pas ni gtsug lag khang der khyim pa mi 'ong na de'i tshe kun dga' bar 'gyur ba zas dang skom la sogs pa ci nus pas nus pa dang mi 'gal bar nus pa'i mthu dang mthun par bzlug par
translated: If a monk who lives in the wilderness and stays in a monastery does not invite a householder to come to the monastery, he should invite him to come to the best of his ability, in a way that will please him, by offering him food and drink, etc.,

original: bya ba srul bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go ;
analyzed: bya ba srul bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go ;
translated: in a way that is appropriate to his ability and that does not conflict with the training.

original: / chu dang stan bstabs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: / chu dang stan bstabs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He should offer him water and a seat.

original: dgon pa pas kyang 'ongs pa la chu dang stan tsam yang bstabs par bya'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dgon pa pas kyang 'ongs pa la chu dang stan tsam yang bstabs par bya'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Even if he is a monk who lives in the wilderness, he should offer water and a seat to those who come to see him.

original: phyag dar dang mal dang stan bshams pa dang / chu gzhag pa dang brim pa dang zan drang ba ni gsar bus bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: phyag dar dang mal dang stan bshams pa dang / chu gzhag pa dang brim pa dang zan drang ba ni gsar bus bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The novice should sweep the temple, prepare the bed and seat, set out the water for drinking and washing, distribute the fruit, and serve the rice gruel.

original: phyag dar la sogs pa gsar bus bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //🔽gnas khang la sogs pa'i phyag dar yang gsar bus bya'o //
analyzed: phyag dar la sogs pa gsar bus bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro // gnas khang la sogs pa'i phyag dar yang gsar bus bya'o //
translated: The novice should sweep the temple, etc.🔽He should also sweep the temple, etc.

original: dge 'dun gyi brang du mal stan bshams pa yang gsar bu de nyid kyis bya'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi brang du mal stan bshams pa yang gsar bu de nyid kyis bya'o //
translated: He should prepare the bed and seat in the assembly hall.

original: chu gzhag pa yang de nyid kyis bya'o //
analyzed: chu gzhag pa yang de nyid kyis bya'o //
translated: He should set out the water for drinking and washing.

original: shing thog la sogs pa brim pa dang / lhung bzed la sogs par zan drang ba yang gsar bus bya ste /
analyzed: shing thog la sogs pa brim pa dang / lhung bzed la sogs par zan drang ba yang gsar bus bya ste /
translated: He should distribute the fruit, and serve the rice gruel in the bowls, etc.

original: dge slong rnams gang dang gang du son pa de dang der de ltar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: dge slong rnams gang dang gang du son pa de dang der de ltar bya ba yin no //
translated: He should do this wherever the monks go.

original: g-yog 'khor gyi bya ba mi mthun pa gal te rang dang gzhan la gnod par mi 'gyur ba ni ci bder gzhag go zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: g-yog 'khor gyi bya ba mi mthun pa gal te rang dang gzhan la gnod par mi 'gyur ba ni ci bder gzhag go zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If the duties of the retinue are incompatible, he should do whatever does not harm himself or others.

original: de btang snyoms su gzhag par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //🔽g-yog 'khor gyi bya ba mi mthun pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de btang snyoms su gzhag par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro // g-yog 'khor gyi bya ba mi mthun pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should remain equanimous, i.e., indifferent.🔽“Disagreeable activities of the retinue”

original: g-yog 'khor gyi rnam par gzhag pa tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa rkyen du mi 'bab pa ste /
analyzed: g-yog 'khor gyi rnam par gzhag pa tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa rkyen du mi 'bab pa ste /
translated: means that the retinue is not properly established, i.e., is not suitable for the occasion.

original: lha drag po'i rten gzugs pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lha drag po'i rten gzugs pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: For example, it is not suitable to make an image of the fierce deity.

original: gal te rang dang gzhan la gnod par mi 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gal te rang dang gzhan la gnod par mi 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “If it does not harm oneself or others”

original: bya ba des dge slong bdag nyid la yang gnod pa'i rgyur mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: bya ba des dge slong bdag nyid la yang gnod pa'i rgyur mi 'gyur la /
translated: means that this activity is not a cause of harm for the monk himself,

original: yul mi gzhan dag la yang gnod pa'i rgyur mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: yul mi gzhan dag la yang gnod pa'i rgyur mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: and it is not a cause of harm for other people in the country.

original: ci bder gzhag go zhes bya ba ni btang snyoms su gzhag par bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci bder gzhag go zhes bya ba ni btang snyoms su gzhag par bya ba'o //
translated: “One should remain as one likes” means that one should remain indifferent.

original: gal te de ltar na nus kyang de dag rgyun bcad la chos dang ldan par bskyed nas des gros gdab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na nus kyang de dag rgyun bcad la chos dang ldan par bskyed nas des gros gdab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “If one is able to do this, one should stop their continuity, and having generated them in a way that accords with the Dharma, one should consult with them”

original: gal te ji ste bya ba de khas blangs pa lta na bdag @76a * //
analyzed: gal te ji ste bya ba de khas blangs pa lta na bdag @76a * //
translated: means that if one accepts this activity, one should stop their continuity, i.e., one should not do it.

original: dang gzhan la gnod pa de ltar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: dang gzhan la gnod pa de ltar 'gyur zhing /
translated: and it is harmful to others.

original: bdag dang gzhan la gnod pa lta na nus su zin kyang g-yog 'khor gyi bya ba mi mthun pa de dag gis bya ba rgyun bcad la /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan la gnod pa lta na nus su zin kyang g-yog 'khor gyi bya ba mi mthun pa de dag gis bya ba rgyun bcad la /
translated: Even if he is able to do so, he should interrupt the work of his retinue and servants who are not in harmony with him,

original: g-yog 'khor gyi bya ba chos dang ldan pa gtsug lag khang du phreng ba dgod pa dang lo lnga'i dus ston la sogs pa gzhan dag bya ba'i sems bskyed nas bya ba de nyid des g-yog 'khor la gros gdab par bya ba'o //
analyzed: g-yog 'khor gyi bya ba chos dang ldan pa gtsug lag khang du phreng ba dgod pa dang lo lnga'i dus ston la sogs pa gzhan dag bya ba'i sems bskyed nas bya ba de nyid des g-yog 'khor la gros gdab par bya ba'o //
translated: and he should arouse his mind to do other virtuous works, such as stringing garlands in the temple and the five-yearly festival, and he should consult his retinue and servants about that work.

original: yang na bskyed nas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yang na bskyed nas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Or, having aroused means

original: rnam par bzhag nas so //
analyzed: rnam par bzhag nas so //
translated: having established.

original: des zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: des zhes bya ba ni /
translated: By that means means

original: chos dang ldan pa'i bya ba des so //
analyzed: chos dang ldan pa'i bya ba des so //
translated: by that virtuous work.

original: gros gdab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gros gdab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He should consult means

original: khyed kyis da phyin chad chos dang ldan pa'i bya ba de bya'o zhes khong du chud par bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyed kyis da phyin chad chos dang ldan pa'i bya ba de bya'o zhes khong du chud par bya ba'o //
translated: that you should understand that henceforth you should do that virtuous work.

original: de'i gzhi las g-yog 'khor mi dga' zhing 'pho ba lta na phyir bsdu bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i gzhi las g-yog 'khor mi dga' zhing 'pho ba lta na phyir bsdu bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If the retinue is unhappy and wants to leave because of that, then one should gather them back.

original: gal te chos dang ldan pa'i bya ba la rnam par gzhag pa de'i gzhi las g-yog 'khor gyi sems mi dga' zhing yid mi bde bar gyur tam /
analyzed: gal te chos dang ldan pa'i bya ba la rnam par gzhag pa de'i gzhi las g-yog 'khor gyi sems mi dga' zhing yid mi bde bar gyur tam /
translated: If the retinue is unhappy and feels badly because of that situation of being established in a Dharma activity,

original: gtsug lag khang gi gnas de nas grong gzhan du 'pho zhing skya ba lta na /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang gi gnas de nas grong gzhan du 'pho zhing skya ba lta na /
translated: or if they want to leave that monastery and go to another village,

original: g-yog 'khor de ci nas kyang mi dga' ba dang 'pho ba de gnyis su yang mi 'gyur la bya ba mi mthun pa de yang rgyun gcod par 'gyur ba de ltar sbyin pa dang snyan par smra ba la sogs pas phyir bsdu bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: g-yog 'khor de ci nas kyang mi dga' ba dang 'pho ba de gnyis su yang mi 'gyur la bya ba mi mthun pa de yang rgyun gcod par 'gyur ba de ltar sbyin pa dang snyan par smra ba la sogs pas phyir bsdu bar bya ba'o //
translated: then one should gather them back by means of generosity, pleasant speech, and so on, so that the retinue will not be unhappy and will not leave, and so that that incompatible activity will be stopped.

original: mi nus pa nyid yin na gzhan du 'gro bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi nus pa nyid yin na gzhan du 'gro bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If one is unable to do that, then one should go elsewhere.

original: g-yog 'khor gyi bya ba mi mthun pa de rgyun gcod par mi nus pa nyid yin na bdag nyid gnas gzhan du 'gro bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: g-yog 'khor gyi bya ba mi mthun pa de rgyun gcod par mi nus pa nyid yin na bdag nyid gnas gzhan du 'gro bar bya ba'o //
translated: If one is unable to stop that incompatible activity of the retinue, then one should go to another place oneself.

original: de'i rkyen gyis rtsod cing smra bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i rkyen gyis rtsod cing smra bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Therefore, one should not speak in a way that causes dispute.

original: dge slong des gtsug lag khang gzhan du 'gro bar bya'i bya ba mi mthun pa rgyun gcad pa dang / chos dang ldan pa'i bya ba la rnam par gzhag pa de'i rkyen gyis g-yog 'khor mi dga' zhing 'pho ba phyir bsdus kyang mi btub na yang rgyu des g-yog 'khor dang lhan cig rtsod cing 'thab pa'i tshig smra bar mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: dge slong des gtsug lag khang gzhan du 'gro bar bya'i bya ba mi mthun pa rgyun gcad pa dang / chos dang ldan pa'i bya ba la rnam par gzhag pa de'i rkyen gyis g-yog 'khor mi dga' zhing 'pho ba phyir bsdus kyang mi btub na yang rgyu des g-yog 'khor dang lhan cig rtsod cing 'thab pa'i tshig smra bar mi bya ba'o //
translated: That monk should go to another monastery. The condition for that is that he should not speak in a way that causes dispute and conflict with his retinue and followers, even if he is unable to gather them back by means of the activities that are in accord with the Dharma and that are continuous and uninterrupted.

original: gal te dge 'dun gyi kun dga' ra bar rkun po la sogs pas gnod par byed na de'i tshe ji ltar bya zhe na /
analyzed: gal te dge 'dun gyi kun dga' ra bar rkun po la sogs pas gnod par byed na de'i tshe ji ltar bya zhe na /
translated: If thieves and so forth harm the Saṅgha's pleasure grove, what should be done at that time?

original: de'i phyir dge 'dun gyi kun dga' ra bar gnod pa byed na ci nas kyang de nyid 'dzin du gzhug pa'i phyir 'dzin pa btang ba de ltar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir dge 'dun gyi kun dga' ra bar gnod pa byed na ci nas kyang de nyid 'dzin du gzhug pa'i phyir 'dzin pa btang ba de ltar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Therefore, if harm is done to the Saṅgha's pleasure grove, it should be done in such a way that the one who is seized is released.

original: dge 'dun gyi kun dga' ra ba gtsug lag khang du rkun po la sogs pas gnod pa byed pas nyes pa byed na /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi kun dga' ra ba gtsug lag khang du rkun po la sogs pas gnod pa byed pas nyes pa byed na /
translated: If a crime is committed by thieves, etc. in the monastery of the Sangha, the retinue should act in such a way that the criminal is apprehended.🔽The meaning is that they should act in such a way that the criminal is apprehended in such a way that he is unable to say anything at all.

original: @76b g-yog 'khor gyis ci nas kyang de nyid 'dzin du gzhug pa mngon sum du zin pas ci nas kyang cung zad kyang smra mi nus par 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir 'dzin pa btang bde ltar thabs bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: @76b g-yog 'khor gyis ci nas kyang de nyid 'dzin du gzhug pa mngon sum du zin pas ci nas kyang cung zad kyang smra mi nus par 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir 'dzin pa btang bde ltar thabs bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If he does not go to apprehend the criminal in order to apprehend him, then he should give up the dispute at the door.

original: ji ste de nyid 'dzin du gzhug pa'i phyir 'dzin pa mi 'gro na yang je sgo nyid du yus rtsod pa btang la /🔽yus su 'gyur bar bsgrub pa btang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ste de nyid 'dzin du gzhug pa'i phyir 'dzin pa mi 'gro na yang je sgo nyid du yus rtsod pa btang la / yus su 'gyur bar bsgrub pa btang ba'i phyir /
translated: If he does not go to give up the dispute, then he should give up the dispute in order to establish the dispute.

original: mi 'gro na ba col du su la yang mi brjod par gzhon nu dang mdza' bshes dang zhang blon dang bkrabs pa dang / zhabs 'bring gnyug ma dag la skad sbyar te /
analyzed: mi 'gro na ba col du su la yang mi brjod par gzhon nu dang mdza' bshes dang zhang blon dang bkrabs pa dang / zhabs 'bring gnyug ma dag la skad sbyar te /
translated: If he does not go to give that up, then he should not speak rashly to anyone, but should speak to the young, friends, uncles, ministers, attendants, and regular servants.

original: gra dag par thul 'og tu gzhug par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gra dag par thul 'og tu gzhug par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: He should be placed under the control of the assembly.

original: gal te g-yog 'khor su yang thabs gang gis kyang 'dzin du mi 'gro na de'i tshe gnod pa byed par 'dzin pa'i g-yog 'khor mi 'gro yang gra dag par thul 'og tu gzhug par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gal te g-yog 'khor su yang thabs gang gis kyang 'dzin du mi 'gro na de'i tshe gnod pa byed par 'dzin pa'i g-yog 'khor mi 'gro yang gra dag par thul 'og tu gzhug par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: If, by any means, he cannot get a retinue, then at that time, he should bring under his control a retinue who will be taken as doing harm.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How?

original: ba bcol du su la yang mi brjod par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: ba bcol du su la yang mi brjod par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: He should not speak rashly to anyone.

original: bab col du zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bab col du zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Rashly means

original: so sor ma brtags par ro //
analyzed: so sor ma brtags par ro //
translated: without examining.

original: su la yang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: su la yang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: To anyone means

original: g-yog 'khor la sogs pa su yang ngo //🔽mi brjod par zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: g-yog 'khor la sogs pa su yang ngo // mi brjod par zhes bya ba ni /
translated: to any retinue, etc.🔽He should not speak means

original: mi smra bar ro //
analyzed: mi smra bar ro //
translated: he should not say.

original: 'di skad bstan te /🔽ci nas kyang g-yog 'khor gzhan gyis mi thos par bdag 'ba' zhig gis bya'o zhes de ltar gsang chen bya zhing /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te / ci nas kyang g-yog 'khor gzhan gyis mi thos par bdag 'ba' zhig gis bya'o zhes de ltar gsang chen bya zhing /
translated: This is what is taught.🔽In such a way that no one else hears, he should do it alone.

original: bab col du g-yog 'khor su la yang brjod par mi bya'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bab col du g-yog 'khor su la yang brjod par mi bya'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: In this way, he should keep it secret. He should not speak rashly to anyone in the retinue.

original: gzhon nu zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhon nu zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Youth means

original: rgyal tshab tu dbang bskur ba'o //
analyzed: rgyal tshab tu dbang bskur ba'o //
translated: He is appointed as the regent.

original: mdza' ba shes zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mdza' ba shes zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “The one who knows the friends”🔽is the king’s.

original: rgyal po'i'o // zhang blon zhes bya ba ni blon po'o //

analyzed: bud med khyim so bzung ba bgag mar btang ba yin na /

analyzed: lo bcu gnyis ma lon pa man chang ni khyim so bzung du zin kyang rdzogs par mi bya'o //

original: de ji ltar skyes she na /

analyzed: de'i phyir / sbyin pa las skye'o zhes bya ba smras te /

original: dge slob ma nyid do //
analyzed: dge slob ma nyid do //

original: sus sbyin pa las she na /
analyzed: sus sbyin pa las she na /

analyzed: de'i phyir dge slong ma'i dge 'dun gyis so zhes bya ba smras so //

original: ji ltar sbyin par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar sbyin par bya zhe na /

analyzed: de ltar na 'dul ba las kyang 'di skad 'byung ste /

analyzed: de'i 'og tu bslab pa brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /

original: de la chos drug ni /
analyzed: de la chos drug ni /

analyzed: @79a * // gcig pu lam du 'gro mi bya //

analyzed: skyes pa dang ni 'dug mi bya //

original: smyan du 'gyur pa mi bya zhing //
analyzed: smyan du 'gyur pa mi bya zhing //

original: kha na ma tho bcab mi bya //
analyzed: kha na ma tho bcab mi bya //

original: zhes bya bdag go //
analyzed: zhes bya bdag go //

original: rjes su mthun pa'i chos drug ni //
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa'i chos drug ni //

analyzed: gser la gzung bar mi bya zhing / mdoms kyi spu ni breg mi bya //

original: sa ni brko bar mi bya ste //🔽rtsa sngon dag kyang gcad mi bya //🔽byin len ma byas bza' mi bya //
analyzed: sa ni brko bar mi bya ste // rtsa sngon dag kyang gcad mi bya // byin len ma byas bza' mi bya //

analyzed: sogs 'jog byas pa bza' mi bya //

original: zhes bya ba dag go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dag go //

analyzed: rgyal mtshan gyi sgra re re ni dbri bar bya'o //

analyzed: bsnyen par ma rdzogs zhes bgyi /

analyzed: mngags @99b pa rgyur gyur pas kyang rku ba ni gang la mngags pa rang gi lus kyis byed pa'o //
translated: One who is sent to steal is one who is sent to steal with one's own body.

original: rkur bcug pa ni gang la mngags pas bcol na gzhan la 'di skad ces song la rang gis rkus shig / song la rkur chug shig ces byed du bcug pa'o //
analyzed: rkur bcug pa ni gang la mngags pas bcol na gzhan la 'di skad ces song la rang gis rkus shig / song la rkur chug shig ces byed du bcug pa'o //
translated: One who is sent to cause to steal is one who is sent to cause another to steal by saying, Go and steal it yourself, or Go and cause someone else to steal it.

original: bcol ba'i dbang gis de ltar rnam par gzhag ste ;
analyzed: bcol ba'i dbang gis de ltar rnam par gzhag ste ;
translated: This is established by the power of being sent.

original: mngags pa'i mngags pas brkus pa yang bye brag med de /
analyzed: mngags pa'i mngags pas brkus pa yang bye brag med de /
translated: One who is sent to steal by one who is sent is also not distinguished.

original: thams cad du pham par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad du pham par 'gyur ro //
translated: In all cases, one becomes a defeated monk.

original: ci zhig rku 'am rkur bcug pa dang mngags pas kyang kha na ma tho pa der 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig rku 'am rkur bcug pa dang mngags pas kyang kha na ma tho pa der 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is stolen, or what is caused to steal, or what is sent to steal, is that which becomes an offense?🔽Therefore, it is said,

original: de'i phyir / ma byin pa'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / ma byin pa'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: without giving.

original: byin pa la yang rku sems kyis len pa srid pas de'i phyir ma byin par zhes bye brag tu byas so //
analyzed: byin pa la yang rku sems kyis len pa srid pas de'i phyir ma byin par zhes bye brag tu byas so //
translated: Since it is possible to take what is given with a mind to steal, therefore it is specified as without giving.

original: 'dir lung ni de la bud med dam skyes pa'am ma ning gang gis kyang ma byin pa zhes gsungs pa de yin no //
analyzed: 'dir lung ni de la bud med dam skyes pa'am ma ning gang gis kyang ma byin pa zhes gsungs pa de yin no //
translated: Here, the scriptural passage is “that which is not given by anyone, whether female, male, or neuter.”

original: tshad ji tsam zhe na /
analyzed: tshad ji tsam zhe na /
translated: What is the measure of that?

original: de'i phyir / ma sha ka lnga la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / ma sha ka lnga la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “five māṣas and so on.”

original: ma byin pa'i rdzas de ma sha ka lnga'i tshad tsam yin pa de ni ma sha ka lnga'o //
analyzed: ma byin pa'i rdzas de ma sha ka lnga'i tshad tsam yin pa de ni ma sha ka lnga'o //
translated: That which is not given is a substance of the measure of five māṣas. That is five māṣas.

original: sogs pa de gang la yod pa de ni de la sogs pa ste de'o //
analyzed: sogs pa de gang la yod pa de ni de la sogs pa ste de'o //
translated: That which has so on is that which has so on.

original: ma byin pa de la sogs pa rku 'am rkur bcug pa dang mngags pas kyang kha na ma tho ba der 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma byin pa de la sogs pa rku 'am rkur bcug pa dang mngags pas kyang kha na ma tho ba der 'gyur ro //
translated: That which is not given and so on is stolen or caused to be stolen or ordered to be stolen. That is the offense.

original: sogs pa zhes smos pas ni drug dang bdun dang brgyad dang dgu dang bcu la sogs pa thams cad bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa zhes smos pas ni drug dang bdun dang brgyad dang dgu dang bcu la sogs pa thams cad bsdu'o //
translated: Since so on is mentioned, all of six, seven, eight, nine, ten and so on are included.

original: 'dir gzhung ni ma sha ka lnga 'am ma sha ka lnga las lhag pas zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni ma sha ka lnga 'am ma sha ka lnga las lhag pas zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here, the text says, “five māṣas or more than five māṣas.”

original: sems ji lta bus she na de'i phyir rku sems kyis so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: sems ji lta bus she na de'i phyir rku sems kyis so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: What is the mind like? Therefore, it is said, “with a mind to steal.”

original: rku ba'i blos rku 'am rkur bcug pa dang / mngags pas kyang kha na ma tho ba der 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rku ba'i blos rku 'am rkur bcug pa dang / mngags pas kyang kha na ma tho ba der 'gyur ro //
translated: If one steals with the thought to steal, or one makes another steal, or one is sent to steal, then one commits an offense.

original: 'di ltar yid gcugs pa'i sems la sogs pa dag gis ni ltung ba med do zhes 'og nas 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar yid gcugs pa'i sems la sogs pa dag gis ni ltung ba med do zhes 'og nas 'byung ngo //
translated: It is said later that there is no offense if one steals with a mind of trust and so on.

original: ci mi ma yin pa'i rgyud kyis yongs su bzung ba'am zhe na /
analyzed: ci mi ma yin pa'i rgyud kyis yongs su bzung ba'am zhe na /
translated: Is it held to be an offense if it is held by the mindstream of a nonhuman?

original: ma yin te de'i phyir /
analyzed: ma yin te de'i phyir /
translated: No, therefore it is said,

original: mi'i rgyud kyis yongs su bzung ba'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: mi'i rgyud kyis yongs su bzung ba'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: it is held by the mindstream of a human.

original: gang mi'i 'gro bar gtogs pa de ni mi'i rgyud de /
analyzed: gang mi'i 'gro bar gtogs pa de ni mi'i rgyud de /
translated: That which is included in the human reincarnating being is the human mindstream.

original: des yongs su bzung ba'o //
analyzed: des yongs su bzung ba'o //
translated: It is held by that.

original: mi'i rgyud kyis yongs su bzung ba de rku'am rkur bcug pa dang mngags pas kyang kha na ma tho ba der 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi'i rgyud kyis yongs su bzung ba de rku'am rkur bcug pa dang mngags pas kyang kha na ma tho ba der 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is held by the human mindstream, then one commits an offense if one steals it, makes another steal it or sends another to steal it.

original: mi ma yin pa'i rgyud kyis yongs su bzung ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mi ma yin pa'i rgyud kyis yongs su bzung ba ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not held by the mindstream of a nonhuman.

original: 'gro ba gzhan gyi rgyud kyis yongs su bzung ba ni na smad do zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba gzhan gyi rgyud kyis yongs su bzung ba ni na smad do zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is said that if it is held by the mindstream of another reincarnating being, then it is not an offense.

original: gal te mi'i rgyud kyis yongs su bzung ba'i rdzas la 'gro ba @100a * //
analyzed: gal te mi'i rgyud kyis yongs su bzung ba'i rdzas la 'gro ba @100a * //
translated: If one steals an object owned by a human being, but one perceives it as owned by someone else, does one still commit a transgression?

original: gzhan gyi rgyud kyis yongs su bzung ba'i 'du shes kyis rku na ci kha na ma tho ba de nyid du 'gyur ram zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi rgyud kyis yongs su bzung ba'i 'du shes kyis rku na ci kha na ma tho ba de nyid du 'gyur ram zhe na ma yin te /
translated: No, one does not.

original: de'i phyir der 'du shes pas so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir der 'du shes pas so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, the root text states, “because of the perception of that object.”

original: mi'i rgyud kyis yongs su bzung ba yin par 'du shes pas so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mi'i rgyud kyis yongs su bzung ba yin par 'du shes pas so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that one perceives the object as belonging to a human being.

original: gal te mi'i rku'o snyam du 'du shes par gyur na des pham pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te mi'i rku'o snyam du 'du shes par gyur na des pham pa yin no //
translated: If one perceives the object as belonging to a human being, then one commits a transgression.

original: 'dir gzhung ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The text states:

original: dge slong gis 'di ltar yo byad lci ba 'di dag gzhan skyes pa'am bud med dam ma ning dag gis yongs su bzung bar 'du shes pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: dge slong gis 'di ltar yo byad lci ba 'di dag gzhan skyes pa'am bud med dam ma ning dag gis yongs su bzung bar 'du shes pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “Monks, if you perceive that a heavy object belongs to another person, whether male or female, or to a neuter person, and you take it, you commit a serious offense.”

original: de ltar na ma byin par len pa'i pham par 'gyur ba 'di ni yan lag lnga dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na ma byin par len pa'i pham par 'gyur ba 'di ni yan lag lnga dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: Thus, the defeat of taking what was not given has five aspects.

original: ma byin pa nyid dang / ma sha ka lnga la sogs pa nyid dang / rku sems nyid dang / mi'i rgyud kyis yongs su bzung ba nyid dang / der 'du shes pa nyid do //
analyzed: ma byin pa nyid dang / ma sha ka lnga la sogs pa nyid dang / rku sems nyid dang / mi'i rgyud kyis yongs su bzung ba nyid dang / der 'du shes pa nyid do //
translated: It is not given, it is five māṣas, and so on, it is with the thought of stealing, it is taken by a human being, and it is recognized as such.

original: yan lag gang yang rung ba ma tshang ba la ni pham par 'gyur ba med de /
analyzed: yan lag gang yang rung ba ma tshang ba la ni pham par 'gyur ba med de /
translated: If any of these factors is incomplete, there is no defeat,

original: na smad pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: na smad pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: but there is only a downfall.

original: mi'i rgyud kyis yongs su bzung ba zhes smras te /
analyzed: mi'i rgyud kyis yongs su bzung ba zhes smras te /
translated: It is taken by a human being.

original: gal te rlung la sogs pa gzhan gyis khyer ba de ci bdag po nyid dang bral ba yan nam 'on te ma yin zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te rlung la sogs pa gzhan gyis khyer ba de ci bdag po nyid dang bral ba yan nam 'on te ma yin zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: If it is carried off by others, such as the wind, is it or is it not still owned?

original: khyer ba nyid na 'di bsam pas ma btang ba ni bdag po nyid dang ma bral ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: khyer ba nyid na 'di bsam pas ma btang ba ni bdag po nyid dang ma bral ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: If it is carried off, it is not abandoned by the owner’s intention.

original: rlung dang rkun po la sogs pa dag gis gos la sogs pa'i rdzas khyer ba nyid na bdag pos bdag gi bya ba'i bsam pas ma btang ba ni rdzas de las bdag po nyid dang ma bral ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: rlung dang rkun po la sogs pa dag gis gos la sogs pa'i rdzas khyer ba nyid na bdag pos bdag gi bya ba'i bsam pas ma btang ba ni rdzas de las bdag po nyid dang ma bral ba nyid yin no //
translated: When thieves and so on carry off the property of others, such as clothing, the owner does not give up ownership of the property by the intention of thinking, “It is mine.”

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: 'di ltar rkun po la sogs pas bdag po'i drung nas rdzas khyer du zin kyang ji srid du bdag pos bdag gi ba nyid kyi bsam pas ma btang ba de srid du rdzas kyi yul de la bdag po nyid dang ma bral ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar rkun po la sogs pas bdag po'i drung nas rdzas khyer du zin kyang ji srid du bdag pos bdag gi ba nyid kyi bsam pas ma btang ba de srid du rdzas kyi yul de la bdag po nyid dang ma bral ba yin no //
translated: Thus, even though thieves and so on carry off the property of others, for as long as the owner does not give up ownership by the intention of thinking, “It is mine,” for that long the owner is not separated from ownership of the property.

original: 'dir gzhung ni /🔽'di ltar btso blag mkhan gyi gos dag bting ba rlung gis khyer zhing de dag dge slod rnams kyi 'chag sa dag gam ra ba dag gam /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni / 'di ltar btso blag mkhan gyi gos dag bting ba rlung gis khyer zhing de dag dge slod rnams kyi 'chag sa dag gam ra ba dag gam /
translated: Here is the text:🔽Thus, when the clothing of a washerman is spread out and is carried off by the wind, if it falls on the walking path of the monks, or in the courtyard,

original: sgo khang dag tu ltung ba la dge slong dag gis de la sbyor bas gnas nas gnas su sped par byed pa'i bar du byed pa ni brkus par brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: sgo khang dag tu ltung ba la dge slong dag gis de la sbyor bas gnas nas gnas su sped par byed pa'i bar du byed pa ni brkus par brjod par bya ste /
translated: or in the doorway, and the monks, by their activity, move it from one place to another, it is said that they have stolen it.

original: rin thang brtsi bar bya zhing dngos po tshang na pham par 'gyur la zhes gsungs pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis rkun po dag @100b rgyal po'i pho brang du phul na srog gcod pa kun nas slong ba'i kha na ma tho bar gsungs kyi /
analyzed: rin thang brtsi bar bya zhing dngos po tshang na pham par 'gyur la zhes gsungs pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis rkun po dag @100b rgyal po'i pho brang du phul na srog gcod pa kun nas slong ba'i kha na ma tho bar gsungs kyi /
translated: The Bhagavān has stated that if thieves are given to the king’s palace, it is a misdeed that motivates the taking of life,

original: ma byin par len pa kun nas slong ba'i kha na ma tho bar ma gsungs te /
analyzed: ma byin par len pa kun nas slong ba'i kha na ma tho bar ma gsungs te /
translated: but he has not stated that it is a misdeed that motivates taking that which is not given.

original: gal te bdag gir byed pa'i bsam pa btang zhing med na ni bdag po nyid dang bral bas de'i tshe ma byin par len pa kun nas slong ba yang brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te bdag gir byed pa'i bsam pa btang zhing med na ni bdag po nyid dang bral bas de'i tshe ma byin par len pa kun nas slong ba yang brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the thought of ownership is relinquished and does not exist, then since it is free of an owner, at that time it is said to be taking that which is not given.

original: mi'i rgyud kyis yongs su bzung ba zhes gsungs na bdag po dang bcas pa'i dud 'gro'i skye gnas su skyes pa'i rdzas brkus na ci zhig tu rnam par gzhag ce na de'i phyir /
analyzed: mi'i rgyud kyis yongs su bzung ba zhes gsungs na bdag po dang bcas pa'i dud 'gro'i skye gnas su skyes pa'i rdzas brkus na ci zhig tu rnam par gzhag ce na de'i phyir /
translated: If it is said that it is held by the continuum of a human, then if one steals an object that is held by an animal that has an owner, how is it posited?

original: tha snyad mi shes pa ni zhal ta byad pa bdag po nyid yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: tha snyad mi shes pa ni zhal ta byad pa bdag po nyid yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it is said that one who does not understand the conventions is the owner himself.

original: tha snyad shes pa ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad smra nus pa ste /
analyzed: tha snyad shes pa ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad smra nus pa ste /
translated: Knowledge of convention is the ability to speak of worldly conventions.

original: de'i rgyud du gtogs pa'i rdzas ni tha snyad shes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyud du gtogs pa'i rdzas ni tha snyad shes pa'o //
translated: The substance that is included in that continuum is knowledge of convention.

original: tha snyad mi shes pa ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad smra mi nus pa ste /
analyzed: tha snyad mi shes pa ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad smra mi nus pa ste /
translated: Ignorance of convention is the inability to speak of worldly conventions.

original: de'i rgyud du gtogs pa'i rdzas ni tha snyad mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyud du gtogs pa'i rdzas ni tha snyad mi shes pa'o //
translated: The substance that is included in that continuum is ignorance of convention.

original: rdzas de la ni zhal ta byed pa skyong bar byed pa bdag po nyid yin no //
analyzed: rdzas de la ni zhal ta byed pa skyong bar byed pa bdag po nyid yin no //
translated: The substance is the owner of the caretaker who protects it.

original: bya rnams kyi yin na yang de la bdag po nyid yod de /
analyzed: bya rnams kyi yin na yang de la bdag po nyid yod de /
translated: Even if it belongs to birds, it has an owner.

original: rdzas ni de'i rgyud du gtogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzas ni de'i rgyud du gtogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the substance is included in its continuum.

original: gnyi ga bdag po nyid yin na ni 'du shes kyi dbang gis ltung ba rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: gnyi ga bdag po nyid yin na ni 'du shes kyi dbang gis ltung ba rnam par gzhag go //
translated: If it belongs to both, the offense is determined by the intention.

original: de ltar 'dir gzhung ni gal te 'di snyam du mi las brku bar bya'i bya la rgyan ga la yod snyam du sems na ni rin thang brtsi bar bya zhing zhes bya ba la sogs ba gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar 'dir gzhung ni gal te 'di snyam du mi las brku bar bya'i bya la rgyan ga la yod snyam du sems na ni rin thang brtsi bar bya zhing zhes bya ba la sogs ba gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, if one thinks here, “I should steal from a human, not from a bird,” then the value should be calculated.

original: ci dud 'gro'i zas dang sgom rku pa la yang de nyid rnam pa gzhag gam zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: ci dud 'gro'i zas dang sgom rku pa la yang de nyid rnam pa gzhag gam zhe na ma yin te /
translated: But is that also the case for stealing the food and bedding of animals?🔽No, it is not.

original: de'i phyir / bza' btung gi phyir byin pa la ni bsam pa dang 'brel pa med pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / bza' btung gi phyir byin pa la ni bsam pa dang 'brel pa med pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that “there is no connection with the intention to give food and drink.”

original: dud 'gro'i skyes gnas su skyes pa'i zas dang / sgom la sogs pa bza' btung gi phyir byin pa gang yin pa de la ni zhal ta byed pa'i bsam pa dang 'brel pa med pa nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dud 'gro'i skyes gnas su skyes pa'i zas dang / sgom la sogs pa bza' btung gi phyir byin pa gang yin pa de la ni zhal ta byed pa'i bsam pa dang 'brel pa med pa nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that there is no connection with the intention of the one who provides the food and drink that is given to animals born in the animal birth state, to those who are insane, and so on.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is explained as follows.

original: dud 'gro'i zas dang sgom gyi phyir bza' ba dang btung ba gang sbyin par byed na der de la sbyin par byed pa 'di bdag gi'o snyam pa'i bsam pa dang / 'bral pa bzlog pas de nyid kyis nye bar sbyor bar byed de /
analyzed: dud 'gro'i zas dang sgom gyi phyir bza' ba dang btung ba gang sbyin par byed na der de la sbyin par byed pa 'di bdag gi'o snyam pa'i bsam pa dang / 'bral pa bzlog pas de nyid kyis nye bar sbyor bar byed de /
translated: When one gives food and drink for the sake of the food and drink of animals and the insane, the intention of the one who gives it there is not connected with the thought “This is mine.”

original: nye bar sbyar nas yang phyir blang ngo snyam pa med pas de'i phyir de la ni dud 'gro nyid bdag po nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: nye bar sbyar nas yang phyir blang ngo snyam pa med pas de'i phyir de la ni dud 'gro nyid bdag po nyid yin gyi /
translated: Since they do not think, I will take it back after using it, they are not owners.

original: zhal ta byed pa ni ma yin no //🔽'dir lung ni dud 'gro'i skal ba chu'i rin thang brtsi bar bya zhing zhes @101a * //
analyzed: zhal ta byed pa ni ma yin no // 'dir lung ni dud 'gro'i skal ba chu'i rin thang brtsi bar bya zhing zhes @101a * //
translated: They are not caretakers.🔽Here, the scriptural passage is:

original: gsungs pa de yin no //
analyzed: gsungs pa de yin no //
translated: The value of water is to be calculated as the share of animals.

original: nags mes btang ba la sogs pa dag gis ri dags la sogs pa gsod pa na de dag la bdag po nyid gang yin zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: nags mes btang ba la sogs pa dag gis ri dags la sogs pa gsod pa na de dag la bdag po nyid gang yin zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: What is the ownership of deer and so on when they are killed by hunters who set forest fires and so on?🔽Therefore it is said:

original: nags mes btang ba la sogs pa dag gis bzung ba'i phyir ri dags dang bya dang sdig sbrul lings btab pa rnams la ni lings pa ma yin pa bdag po nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: nags mes btang ba la sogs pa dag gis bzung ba'i phyir ri dags dang bya dang sdig sbrul lings btab pa rnams la ni lings pa ma yin pa bdag po nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Those who set forest fires and so on are not owners of deer, birds and poisonous snakes that are caught, since they are not hunters.

original: rngon pa la sogs pa lings bdag gis nags mes btad ba la sogs pa dag gi thabs kyis bzung ba'i phyir ri dags la sogs pa lings btab pa bshor ba gang dag yin pa'i ri dags la sogs pa lings btab pa de rnams ni lings pa kho na🔽bdag po dbang ba nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: rngon pa la sogs pa lings bdag gis nags mes btad ba la sogs pa dag gi thabs kyis bzung ba'i phyir ri dags la sogs pa lings btab pa bshor ba gang dag yin pa'i ri dags la sogs pa lings btab pa de rnams ni lings pa kho na bdag po dbang ba nyid yin gyi /
translated: The deer, etc., that have been trapped are those that are trapped.

original: lings pa ma yin pa bdag po dbang ba nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: lings pa ma yin pa bdag po dbang ba nyid ma yin no //
translated: Those that have not been trapped are not those that are trapped.

original: de lta bas na lings pa ma yin pas gal te rku sems kyis len par byed na de las rkun por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na lings pa ma yin pas gal te rku sems kyis len par byed na de las rkun por 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, if one takes with a thieving mind those that have not been trapped, one becomes a thief.

original: ri dags la sogs pa smos pa ni dpe yin te /
analyzed: ri dags la sogs pa smos pa ni dpe yin te /
translated: The mention of deer, etc., is an example.

original: phyugs dang mi lings btab pa bdag po dang bcas pa dang / bdag po med pa dag lings pa las bkrus na rkun po nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: phyugs dang mi lings btab pa bdag po dang bcas pa dang / bdag po med pa dag lings pa las bkrus na rkun po nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: Cattle and humans that have been trapped are those that have an owner and those that do not have an owner. If one steals those that have not been trapped, one becomes a thief.

original: bdag po gzhan yod du zin kyang 'di ltar de'i tshe na lings pa kho na nyid dbang ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag po gzhan yod du zin kyang 'di ltar de'i tshe na lings pa kho na nyid dbang ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even if there is another owner, at that time, only those that have been trapped are those that have an owner.

original: bdag po ma nges pa'i rdzas la ltung ba ji ltar rnam par gzhag ce na de'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag po ma nges pa'i rdzas la ltung ba ji ltar rnam par gzhag ce na de'i phyir /
translated: How is a downfall posited in regard to a substance that does not have a definite owner?🔽Therefore, it is said:

original: bye brag ma phyed pa la ni gzhi las rnam par gzhag go zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: bye brag ma phyed pa la ni gzhi las rnam par gzhag go zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In regard to what is not distinguished, it is posited on the basis.

original: bye brag phyed pa ni yongs su bcad pa nges pa'o //
analyzed: bye brag phyed pa ni yongs su bcad pa nges pa'o //
translated: Distinguishing is a definite determination.

original: bye brag ma phyed pa ni yongs su bcad pa ma nges pa ste /
analyzed: bye brag ma phyed pa ni yongs su bcad pa ma nges pa ste /
translated: Not distinguishing is an indefinite determination.

original: 'di bdag po dang bcas pa zhig gam 'on te ma yin zhes bye brag ma phyed pa gter la sogs pa'i rdzas gang ci yang rung ba brkus pa la ni gzhi'i ngo bo nyid las ltung ba rnam par gzhag gi 'du shes la ni mi gzhag go //
analyzed: 'di bdag po dang bcas pa zhig gam 'on te ma yin zhes bye brag ma phyed pa gter la sogs pa'i rdzas gang ci yang rung ba brkus pa la ni gzhi'i ngo bo nyid las ltung ba rnam par gzhag gi 'du shes la ni mi gzhag go //
translated: In regard to any substance such as a treasure that is not distinguished as to whether or not it has an owner, a downfall is posited on the basis of the nature of the substance, and not on the basis of the perception.

original: gal te bdag po dang bcas pa zhig na ni gzhi las yan lag tshang na pham par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te bdag po dang bcas pa zhig na ni gzhi las yan lag tshang na pham par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it has an owner, then if the basis is complete, there is a root downfall.

original: bdag po med pa zhig na ni sbom por rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: bdag po med pa zhig na ni sbom por rnam par gzhag go //
translated: If it has no owner, then it is posited as a serious transgression.

original: rin thang brtsi bar bya'o zhes smras na /
analyzed: rin thang brtsi bar bya'o zhes smras na /
translated: If one says, “I will calculate its value,”

original: gnas dang dus tha dad pas rdzas rnams kyi rin thang yang tha dad par snang na /
analyzed: gnas dang dus tha dad pas rdzas rnams kyi rin thang yang tha dad par snang na /
translated: Since the value of substances is different due to different places and times,

original: gang gi tshe rin thang rnam par gzhag par bya zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rin thang rnam par gzhag par bya zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: when should the value be determined?

original: rin thang ni brkus pa'i gnas dang dus kyis so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: rin thang ni brkus pa'i gnas dang dus kyis so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it is said, “The value is determined by the place and time of the theft.”

original: rnam par gzhag go zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: rnam par gzhag go zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The term “determined” should be applied.

original: rin thang ni brkus pa'i gnas gang yin pa dang / dus @101b gang yin pa des rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: rin thang ni brkus pa'i gnas gang yin pa dang / dus @101b gang yin pa des rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The value is determined by the place and time of the theft.

original: 'di skad bstan te /🔽yul gang du brkus pa dang / dus gang gi tshe brkus pa'i yul de nyid kyi dang dus de nyid kyi tshe'i rdzas de'i rin thang dang sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te / yul gang du brkus pa dang / dus gang gi tshe brkus pa'i yul de nyid kyi dang dus de nyid kyi tshe'i rdzas de'i rin thang dang sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: This is explained as follows.🔽The value of a substance should be determined by the place and time of the theft.

original: des ltung ba rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: des ltung ba rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The substance’s value should be determined by the place and time of the theft.

original: rku 'am rkur bcug pa dag gis so zhes smras na /
analyzed: rku 'am rkur bcug pa dag gis so zhes smras na /
translated: If it is said, “The value is determined by the place and time of the theft,”

original: ma bsams pa brkus na ci zhig tu rnam par gzhag ce na de'i phyir /
analyzed: ma bsams pa brkus na ci zhig tu rnam par gzhag ce na de'i phyir /
translated: what is the determination if one steals without thinking?🔽Therefore it is said,

original: ma bsams pa la ltung ba med do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ma bsams pa la ltung ba med do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: There is no offense if one does not intend to steal.

original: ma bsams pa'i dngos po 'khrul pas brkus pa gang yin pa de la ni ltung ba med do //
analyzed: ma bsams pa'i dngos po 'khrul pas brkus pa gang yin pa de la ni ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one steals an object without intending to commit theft.

original: de ltar yang nye ba 'khor gyis zhus pa las /
analyzed: de ltar yang nye ba 'khor gyis zhus pa las /
translated: Thus the Upaliparipṛcchā says:

original: btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis rku sems kyis chos gos kyi gdang bu brkus pa der chos gos dag kyang zhar la mchis na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
analyzed: btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis rku sems kyis chos gos kyi gdang bu brkus pa der chos gos dag kyang zhar la mchis na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
translated: “Lord, if a monk with a mind to steal takes a clothesline, does he commit an offense or not?”

original: chos gos kyi gdang bu'i rin thang brtsi bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: chos gos kyi gdang bu'i rin thang brtsi bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: “You should calculate the value of the clothesline.”

original: chos gos dag gi rin thang brtsi ba ni ma gsungs te /
analyzed: chos gos dag gi rin thang brtsi ba ni ma gsungs te /
translated: But he did not say to calculate the value of the clothes,

original: ma bsams pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma bsams pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there was no intention to steal them.

original: rku sems kyis so zhes bya ba smras na /
analyzed: rku sems kyis so zhes bya ba smras na /
translated: If he says, “With a mind to steal,”

original: sems gzhan gyis cir 'gyur zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: sems gzhan gyis cir 'gyur zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: what if he takes them with another kind of mind?

original: rang dang brnya ba dang yid gcugs pa'i sems dag gis gzhan la go bar bya ste /
analyzed: rang dang brnya ba dang yid gcugs pa'i sems dag gis gzhan la go bar bya ste /
translated: “He should make it understood to others with a mind of his own or with a mind of trust in another.

original: blangs na ltung ba med do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: blangs na ltung ba med do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: If he takes it, there is no offense.”

original: rang gi sems dang brnya ba'i sems dang / yid gcugs pa'i sems ni rang dang brnya ba dang yid gcugs pa'i sems te /
analyzed: rang gi sems dang brnya ba'i sems dang / yid gcugs pa'i sems ni rang dang brnya ba dang yid gcugs pa'i sems te /
translated: One’s own mind, the mind of one who is equal, and the mind of one who is friendly are one’s own mind, the mind of one who is equal, and the mind of one who is friendly.

original: rang gi sems la sogs pa de dag gis rku sems med par gzhan la go bar byas te blangs na ltung ba med do //
analyzed: rang gi sems la sogs pa de dag gis rku sems med par gzhan la go bar byas te blangs na ltung ba med do //
translated: If one takes another’s property without a thieving mind, and one makes it understood to the other, there is no offense.

original: la la 'di la rku sems med par zhes bya ba de smos mi dgos te /
analyzed: la la 'di la rku sems med par zhes bya ba de smos mi dgos te /
translated: Some say that it is not necessary to state “without a thieving mind” here,

original: rang gi rdzas la rku sems mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes zer na /🔽de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi rdzas la rku sems mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes zer na / de lta ma yin te /
translated: because it is impossible to have a thieving mind with regard to one’s own property.

original: rang gi rdzas la yang rku sems srid pa kho na ste /
analyzed: rang gi rdzas la yang rku sems srid pa kho na ste /
