translated: That is not so, because it is possible to have a thieving mind with regard to one’s own property.

original: gang gi tshe rang gi rdzas gzhan gyi lag tu 'doms shing phyis rku sems kyis ci nas kyang skyin pa 'jal du gzhug go snyam nas de las rku bar byed pa yod pas de'i phyir rku sems med pa zhes bye brag tu bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rang gi rdzas gzhan gyi lag tu 'doms shing phyis rku sems kyis ci nas kyang skyin pa 'jal du gzhug go snyam nas de las rku bar byed pa yod pas de'i phyir rku sems med pa zhes bye brag tu bya ba'o //
translated: When one entrusts one’s property to another, and later one has a thieving mind, thinking “I will do anything to get it back,” and one steals it from that person, therefore it is specified that there is no offense if there is no thieving mind.

original: de ltar yang dge slong gis rang gi lhung bzed dang chos gos kyang rku sems kyis len na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur bas /
analyzed: de ltar yang dge slong gis rang gi lhung bzed dang chos gos kyang rku sems kyis len na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur bas /
translated: Thus, if a bhikṣu takes his own alms bowl and robes with a thought to steal, he commits a serious offense.

original: dge slong gis rang dang brnya ba dang yid gcugs pa'i sems dag gis blang bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: dge slong gis rang dang brnya ba dang yid gcugs pa'i sems dag gis blang bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is said that a bhikṣu should take them with a thought of his own property and a thought of trust.

original: ji skad du 'di bdag gis bskur ro zhes gzhan la go bar bya'o zhes gsungs na mdo byed pas /🔽gzhan @102a * //
analyzed: ji skad du 'di bdag gis bskur ro zhes gzhan la go bar bya'o zhes gsungs na mdo byed pas / gzhan @102a * //
translated: If it is said, “One should make it understood to another, ‘I will send this to you,’ ” why does the sūtra say,

original: la go bar byas te zhes ci'i phyir smras she na /
analyzed: la go bar byas te zhes ci'i phyir smras she na /
translated: “One should make it understood to another”?

original: de ltar yang gzhung las gzhan la go bar bya'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar yang gzhung las gzhan la go bar bya'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it says in the text, “One should make it understood to another.”

original: rku sems med pa gzhan gyis kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rku sems med pa gzhan gyis kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Also, it is said that there is no offense if one takes it with another’s property in mind.

original: rnam pa gsum po de dag ma gtogs pa rku sems med pa rnam pa gzhan gyis blangs pa yang nyes pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum po de dag ma gtogs pa rku sems med pa rnam pa gzhan gyis blangs pa yang nyes pa med pa'o //
translated: If one takes it with a form of mind other than these three, there is no offense.

original: rnam pa gzhan gyis kyang ji ltar nyes pa med ce na /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan gyis kyang ji ltar nyes pa med ce na /
translated: How can there be no offense if it is taken with another form of mind?

original: nye ba 'khor gyis zhus pa las dge slong gis dge slong la 'di skad ces smras te /
analyzed: nye ba 'khor gyis zhus pa las dge slong gis dge slong la 'di skad ces smras te /
translated: The Questions of Upāli states:🔽A monk says to another monk, “Do you know that monk’s belongings?”

original: khyod kyis dge slong che ge mo'i yo byad de dang de dag shes sam shes so //
analyzed: khyod kyis dge slong che ge mo'i yo byad de dang de dag shes sam shes so //
translated: “Yes, I know them.”

original: 'o na song la de dag rkus shig de dag phrogs shig / de dag gnas gzhan nas gzhan du spos shig ces bsgo nas /
analyzed: 'o na song la de dag rkus shig de dag phrogs shig / de dag gnas gzhan nas gzhan du spos shig ces bsgo nas /
translated: “Well, go and steal them, rob them, and move them from one place to another.”

original: gal te de rku sems kyis de dag rku bar byed /
analyzed: gal te de rku sems kyis de dag rku bar byed /
translated: If the other steals them with a mind to steal,

original: de dag 'phrog par byed /
analyzed: de dag 'phrog par byed /
translated: robs them,

original: de dag gnas nas gnas gzhan du spo bar byed na ni gnyi ga la 'dra bar ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gnas nas gnas gzhan du spo bar byed na ni gnyi ga la 'dra bar ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and moves them from one place to another, then both are similar in their downfall.

original: 'on te de 'di snyam du 'di ni de'i 'o snyam na len pa po la ltung bar mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'on te de 'di snyam du 'di ni de'i 'o snyam na len pa po la ltung bar mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: But if the other thinks, “This is his,” then the one who takes them does not commit a downfall.

original: rkur 'jug pa po gang yin pa de ni gzhi ji lta ba bzhin du ltung bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rkur 'jug pa po gang yin pa de ni gzhi ji lta ba bzhin du ltung bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The one who instigated the theft is to be dealt with according to the basis of the theft.

original: snying rje rdzu 'phrul gyis phrogs na'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: snying rje rdzu 'phrul gyis phrogs na'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If they are stolen through the power of the Buddha’s compassion.

original: ltung ba med do zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: ltung ba med do zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: The phrase “there is no offense” should be applied here.

original: snying rjes rgyu byas pa'i snying rje sngon du btang ba'i rdzu 'phrul gan gyin pa'i rdzu 'phrul des phrog pa po las mi la sogs pa phrogs na ltung ba med do //
analyzed: snying rjes rgyu byas pa'i snying rje sngon du btang ba'i rdzu 'phrul gan gyin pa'i rdzu 'phrul des phrog pa po las mi la sogs pa phrogs na ltung ba med do //
translated: If one steals the possessions of a thief and so on through the superknowledge of magical emanation that is preceded by compassion and motivated by compassion, there is no offense.

original: 'di ltar snying rje dang ldan pa'i sems kyis na nyes byas so zhes 'og nas 'byung mod kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar snying rje dang ldan pa'i sems kyis na nyes byas so zhes 'og nas 'byung mod kyi /
translated: Although it is said below that “there is an offense of wrong conduct for one who has a compassionate mind,”

original: 'on kyang snying rje sngon du btang ba'i rdzu 'phrul gyi sems kyi rigs de 'dra ba de ni bsgoms pa las byung ba yin pas de la ni ltung bar 'gyur ba med do ;
analyzed: 'on kyang snying rje sngon du btang ba'i rdzu 'phrul gyi sems kyi rigs de 'dra ba de ni bsgoms pa las byung ba yin pas de la ni ltung bar 'gyur ba med do ;
translated: nevertheless, since that type of mind of superknowledge that is preceded by compassion arises from meditation, there is no offense for that.

original: / dngos gzhi'i ltung ba bstan pa'i 'og tu sbyor ba'i ltung ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: / dngos gzhi'i ltung ba bstan pa'i 'og tu sbyor ba'i ltung ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: After teaching the offenses of the actual basis, in order to teach the offenses of preparation,

original: thams cad du sbyor ba la ni nyes byas so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: thams cad du sbyor ba la ni nyes byas so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: it is said, “There is an offense of wrong conduct for all preparations.”

original: ltung ba thams cad la'ang sbyor ba gang yin pa de la ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: ltung ba thams cad la'ang sbyor ba gang yin pa de la ni nyes byas so //
translated: For all offenses, the preparation is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: de ni spyir btang ba ste /
analyzed: de ni spyir btang ba ste /
translated: This is a general statement.

original: de'i dmigs kyis bsal ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i dmigs kyis bsal ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To explain the exceptions to that,

original: sde tshan de la gal te dngos gzhi'i yin na sbom po'o zhes bya ba smras te /🔽pham bar 'gyur ba'i sde tshan de la sbyor ba de gal te dngos gzhi'i yin na sbyor ba de la sbom po'o //
analyzed: sde tshan de la gal te dngos gzhi'i yin na sbom po'o zhes bya ba smras te / pham bar 'gyur ba'i sde tshan de la sbyor ba de gal te dngos gzhi'i yin na sbyor ba de la sbom po'o //
translated: it is said, “If it is the actual basis of that class, it is a serious offense.”🔽If that preparation is the actual basis of that class of the defeating offenses, that preparation is a serious offense.

original: ji ste sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yin na de la ni nyes byas kho na'o //
analyzed: ji ste sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yin na de la ni nyes byas kho na'o //
translated: But if it is the preparation for the preparation, then it is only a minor offense.

original: de nyid dge 'dun lhag ma zhes bya ba'i sde tshan la yang 'dra bar @102b bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid dge 'dun lhag ma zhes bya ba'i sde tshan la yang 'dra bar @102b bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To explain that the same applies to the class called “remainder of the Saṅgha,”

original: 'og ma la yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'og ma la yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: it is said, “The same applies to the latter.”

original: pham par 'gyur ba'i sde tshan gang la sbyor ba de la dngos gzhi'i sbom po zhes gang gsungs pa de bzhin du 'og ma dge 'dun lhag ma zhes bya ba'i sde tshan la yang de bzhin du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: pham par 'gyur ba'i sde tshan gang la sbyor ba de la dngos gzhi'i sbom po zhes gang gsungs pa de bzhin du 'og ma dge 'dun lhag ma zhes bya ba'i sde tshan la yang de bzhin du rig par bya ste /
translated: The same should be understood to apply to the latter class called “remainder of the Saṅgha,”

original: gal te dngos gzhi'i sbyor ba yin na ni sbom po'o //
analyzed: gal te dngos gzhi'i sbyor ba yin na ni sbom po'o //
translated: where it is said, “If it is the actual basis of that preparation, it is a serious offense.”

original: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yin na ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yin na ni nyes byas so //
translated: If it is a preparation for a preparation, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: ma sha ka lnga la sogs pa brkus sam rkur bcug pa dag gis pham par 'gyur bar bstan na /🔽ma chog pa'i brjod par bya ba bsten pa'i phyir ma tshog pa brkus na'o zhes bya ba smras te /🔽'di man chad 'og nas snying rje dang ldan pa'i sems kyis na nyes byas so zhes 'byung ba'i mdo yan chad ni sbom po'o zhes bya ba'i dbang du bya'o //
analyzed: ma sha ka lnga la sogs pa brkus sam rkur bcug pa dag gis pham par 'gyur bar bstan na / ma chog pa'i brjod par bya ba bsten pa'i phyir ma tshog pa brkus na'o zhes bya ba smras te / 'di man chad 'og nas snying rje dang ldan pa'i sems kyis na nyes byas so zhes 'byung ba'i mdo yan chad ni sbom po'o zhes bya ba'i dbang du bya'o //
translated: If one steals or induces another to steal five māsakas or more, one is defeated.🔽The root text declares, “If one steals more than a māsaka, because one has engaged in the basis for a pārājika offense.”🔽The root text declares, “If one steals less than a māsaka, because one has engaged in the basis for a pārājika offense.”

original: ma sha ka lngar mchog ba brkus na yan lag gzhan thams cad yod kyang sbom por rig par bya ste /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: ma sha ka lngar mchog ba brkus na yan lag gzhan thams cad yod kyang sbom por rig par bya ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: The root text declares, “If one steals more than a māsaka, because one has engaged in the basis for a sthūlātyaya offense.”

original: ma byin pa dang / rku sems kyis dang / mi'i rgyud kyis yongs su bzung ba dang / der 'du shes pas zhes bya ba yan lag de dag yod kyang ma sha ka ldar ma chog pa brkus sam /
analyzed: ma byin pa dang / rku sems kyis dang / mi'i rgyud kyis yongs su bzung ba dang / der 'du shes pas zhes bya ba yan lag de dag yod kyang ma sha ka ldar ma chog pa brkus sam /
translated: The root text declares, “If one steals less than a māsaka, because one has engaged in the basis for a sthūlātyaya offense.”🔽The root text declares, “If one steals more than a māsaka, because one has engaged in the basis for a sthūlātyaya offense.”

original: rkur bcug pa dang / mngags pas kyang sbom po kho na'o //
analyzed: rkur bcug pa dang / mngags pas kyang sbom po kho na'o //
translated: And if one steals by proxy, it is a serious violation.

original: kha cig tu ni yan lag gsum mam gnyis ma tshang ba la nyes byas su 'dod de /
analyzed: kha cig tu ni yan lag gsum mam gnyis ma tshang ba la nyes byas su 'dod de /
translated: Some assert that if three or two branches are incomplete, it is a minor offense.

original: 'di lta ste /🔽mi ma yin pa'i rgyud kyis yongs su bzung ba la der 'du shes ba'am /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / mi ma yin pa'i rgyud kyis yongs su bzung ba la der 'du shes ba'am /
translated: This is because:🔽if one has the perception that the object is not owned by a human being,

original: mi'i rgyud kyis yongs su bzung bar 'du shes pa dang / ma chog pa brkus pa ni nyes byas te /
analyzed: mi'i rgyud kyis yongs su bzung bar 'du shes pa dang / ma chog pa brkus pa ni nyes byas te /
translated: or if one has the perception that the object is owned by a human being, but one steals less than a threshing-floor full, it is a minor offense.

original: yan lag rnams ma tshang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yan lag rnams ma tshang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the branches are incomplete.

original: de bzhin du bdag po gang yang rung bas yongs su ma bzung ba dang / ma chog pa dang / mi ma yin pa'i rgyud kyis yongs su bzung ba dang / der 'du shes med pa la yang nyes byas kho na'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag po gang yang rung bas yongs su ma bzung ba dang / ma chog pa dang / mi ma yin pa'i rgyud kyis yongs su bzung ba dang / der 'du shes med pa la yang nyes byas kho na'o //
translated: Similarly, if the object is not owned by anyone, or is less than a threshing-floor full, or is owned by a nonhuman being, or if one has no perception of it, it is a minor offense.

original: rku sems med na ni thams cad du ltung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rku sems med na ni thams cad du ltung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If one has no intention to steal, one does not commit a downfall in any case.

original: de'i phyir 'dir rku sems ni dngos gzhi'i yan lag yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir rku sems ni dngos gzhi'i yan lag yin la /
translated: Therefore, the intention to steal is the actual branch.

original: lhag ma rnams ni de'i bye brag yin no //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni de'i bye brag yin no //
translated: The remaining branches are its particularities.

original: mi'i rgyud kyis yongs su bzung ba zhes bya ba des ni bdag po dang bcas pa brkus nas pham par 'gyur ba bstan na /🔽bdag po med pa brkus na cir 'gyur zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: mi'i rgyud kyis yongs su bzung ba zhes bya ba des ni bdag po dang bcas pa brkus nas pham par 'gyur ba bstan na / bdag po med pa brkus na cir 'gyur zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: The phrase owned by a human indicates that one commits a defeating offense if one steals what is owned by another.

original: bdag po med pa'i gter ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: bdag po med pa'i gter ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: What if one steals what is not owned by another? The text states, A treasure that is not owned by another.

original: brkus na sbom po'o //
analyzed: brkus na sbom po'o //
translated: If one steals it, one commits a serious transgression.

original: gter de yang gal te bdag pos don ma rtogs pa yin pa'o //🔽'di ltar @103a * //
analyzed: gter de yang gal te bdag pos don ma rtogs pa yin pa'o // 'di ltar @103a * //
translated: If the owner does not know that it is his treasure, it is not owned by another.

original: dngos su na de la bdag po yod mod kyi 'on kyang des don ma rtogs par gyur pa ni bdag po med pa zhes bya'o //🔽de ltar gzhung ni /
analyzed: dngos su na de la bdag po yod mod kyi 'on kyang des don ma rtogs par gyur pa ni bdag po med pa zhes bya'o // de ltar gzhung ni /
translated: In fact, it is owned by someone, but it is said to be not owned by another because the owner does not know that it is his treasure.

original: des nad g-yogs la smras pa /
analyzed: des nad g-yogs la smras pa /
translated: The text states, The monk said to the caretaker,🔽'Prepare three kinds of pastries and a soup. I will give them to the community of monks and I will eat and drink.'

original: khur ba sna gsum pa dang thug pa sta gon gyis shig dang / dge 'dun la yang dbul rang yang bza' btung bya'o zhes byas nas des de dag la zong phog go //
analyzed: khur ba sna gsum pa dang thug pa sta gon gyis shig dang / dge 'dun la yang dbul rang yang bza' btung bya'o zhes byas nas des de dag la zong phog go //
translated: He gave the money to the caretaker.

original: de dag 'di snyam du bdag cag la khur ba sna gsum pa dang / thug pas ci bya /
analyzed: de dag 'di snyam du bdag cag la khur ba sna gsum pa dang / thug pas ci bya /
translated: The caretaker thought, 'What will I do with three kinds of pastries and a soup?

original: 'di la khur ba sna gsum pa dang / thug pa zhig byin la zong bdag cag gis bgo bar bya'o snyam nas /
analyzed: 'di la khur ba sna gsum pa dang / thug pa zhig byin la zong bdag cag gis bgo bar bya'o snyam nas /
translated: They thought, We will give him a third of the load and a third of the gruel. We will divide the goods among ourselves.

original: de dag gis de la khur ba sna gsum pa dang / thug pa zhig byin te zong bgos so //
analyzed: de dag gis de la khur ba sna gsum pa dang / thug pa zhig byin te zong bgos so //
translated: They gave him a third of the load and a third of the gruel and divided the goods among themselves.

original: de dag 'gyod pa skyes nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de dag 'gyod pa skyes nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: They became remorseful. The Blessed One said,

original: pham par 'gyur ba'i ltung ba ni med de /
analyzed: pham par 'gyur ba'i ltung ba ni med de /
translated: There is no defeat,

original: nyes pa sbom po'i ltung bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: nyes pa sbom po'i ltung bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: but there is a grave offense.

original: gang dag la phul ba de dag la der bdag gir bya ba skyes par ma gyur pas de'i phyir pham par 'gyur ba'i rgyu med par snang ngo //
analyzed: gang dag la phul ba de dag la der bdag gir bya ba skyes par ma gyur pas de'i phyir pham par 'gyur ba'i rgyu med par snang ngo //
translated: Since they did not generate the idea of ownership in regard to what was given to them, it appears that there is no cause for defeat.

original: gter gang la bdag po'i don rtogs pa dang / don ma rtogs pa gnyi ga med pa de la ji ltar bsgrub ce na /
analyzed: gter gang la bdag po'i don rtogs pa dang / don ma rtogs pa gnyi ga med pa de la ji ltar bsgrub ce na /
translated: How can one establish a rule for a treasure that has no owner, whether the meaning is understood or not?

original: dper na byang gi sgra mi snyan pa rnams kyi rdzas brkus pa bzhin te /
analyzed: dper na byang gi sgra mi snyan pa rnams kyi rdzas brkus pa bzhin te /
translated: For example, it is like stealing the property of the Uttarakuru people.

original: gal te rku sems med na de'i tshe ltung ba med de /
analyzed: gal te rku sems med na de'i tshe ltung ba med de /
translated: If there is no thought of stealing, then there is no offense.

original: bdag gi ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag gi ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no mine.

original: ji ste rku sems skyed par byed na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ste rku sems skyed par byed na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
translated: If one generates the thought to steal, a serious downfall is accrued.

original: gal te bdag pos don ma rtogs pa'i gter de nyid ma sha ka lnga la sogs pa las nyung ba la bdag po med par 'du shes pas sam /
analyzed: gal te bdag pos don ma rtogs pa'i gter de nyid ma sha ka lnga la sogs pa las nyung ba la bdag po med par 'du shes pas sam /
translated: If the owner does not understand the meaning of the treasure, and if one perceives that the treasure is less than five māsakas and so on and that it has no owner,

original: bdag po dang bcas par 'du shes pas sam /🔽bdag po mis sam /
analyzed: bdag po dang bcas par 'du shes pas sam / bdag po mis sam /
translated: or if one perceives that it has an owner,🔽or if one perceives that it is owned by a human or

original: mi ma yin pas yongs su bzung bar 'du shes pas de brkus na nyes byas te /
analyzed: mi ma yin pas yongs su bzung bar 'du shes pas de brkus na nyes byas te /
translated: a nonhuman, then if one steals it, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: sbom po'i dbang du byas pa'i yan lag dag pas nyung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbom po'i dbang du byas pa'i yan lag dag pas nyung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is less than the branch that is the basis of a serious downfall.

original: gzhan gyis brkus na dngos gzhir 'gyur la /
analyzed: gzhan gyis brkus na dngos gzhir 'gyur la /
translated: If another steals it, it becomes the actual basis.

original: rang gi cir 'gyur zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: rang gi cir 'gyur zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: What if it is one’s own?

original: rang gi'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: rang gi'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The text says, “One’s own is the same.”

original: rang gi rdzas ma sha ka lnga la sogs pa rku sems kyis der 'du shes pas rku 'am /
analyzed: rang gi rdzas ma sha ka lnga la sogs pa rku sems kyis der 'du shes pas rku 'am /
translated: If one steals one’s own property, such as five māsakas and so on, with the thought to steal and with the perception that it is that,

original: rkur bcug pa dang mngags pas kyang sbom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rkur bcug pa dang mngags pas kyang sbom por 'gyur ro //
translated: or if one steals it by oneself, or if one makes another steal it, or if one sends someone to steal it, then one commits a serious downfall.

original: der 'du shes pa zhes bya ba'i tshig de skabs 'dir ni rang gir 'du shes pa zhes bya bar @103b rig par bya'o //
analyzed: der 'du shes pa zhes bya ba'i tshig de skabs 'dir ni rang gir 'du shes pa zhes bya bar @103b rig par bya'o //
translated: In this context, the term “perception of it as one’s own” should be understood as “perception of it as one’s own.”

original: de ltar yang gzhung ni de'i phyir dge slong gis rang gi lhung bzed dang / chos gos kyang rku sems kyis blang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar yang gzhung ni de'i phyir dge slong gis rang gi lhung bzed dang / chos gos kyang rku sems kyis blang bar mi bya'o //
translated: Thus, the text states: “Therefore, a monk should not take his own begging bowl and robes with a thieving mind.

original: dge slong gis rang gi lhung bzed dang / chos gos rku sems kyis len na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: dge slong gis rang gi lhung bzed dang / chos gos rku sems kyis len na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If a monk takes his own begging bowl and robes with a thieving mind, he commits a serious offense.”

original: rang gi la gzhan gyis yongs su bzung bar 'du shes pa la yang sbom po kho na ste /
analyzed: rang gi la gzhan gyis yongs su bzung bar 'du shes pa la yang sbom po kho na ste /
translated: If he perceives what belongs to another as belonging to another, he also commits a serious offense.

original: rku sems shin tu lci ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rku sems shin tu lci ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the thieving mind is very heavy.

original: de ltar yang gzhung ni dge slong dag mi pham pa mi gti mug can 'di ni rang gi chos gos rnyang rnying dag gis nyes pa sbom po'i ltung ba byung ngo zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar yang gzhung ni dge slong dag mi pham pa mi gti mug can 'di ni rang gi chos gos rnyang rnying dag gis nyes pa sbom po'i ltung ba byung ngo zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the text states: “Monks, this Ajita, who is confused, has committed a serious offense with his own old robe.”

original: rang gi la gzhan gyis yongs su ma bzung bar 'du shes pa la yang sbom po kho na ste /
analyzed: rang gi la gzhan gyis yongs su ma bzung bar 'du shes pa la yang sbom po kho na ste /
translated: Also, if one perceives one's own property as not belonging to another, it is only a serious violation.

original: rang gir 'du shes pa dang yongs su ma bzung bar 'du shes pa ni lhan cig ltung ba 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gir 'du shes pa dang yongs su ma bzung bar 'du shes pa ni lhan cig ltung ba 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the perception of one's own property and the perception of not belonging to another are similar to the downfall of a monk.

original: de bzhin du yongs su ma bzung ba la yongs su ma bzung bar 'du shes pa'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du yongs su ma bzung ba la yongs su ma bzung bar 'du shes pa'am /
translated: Similarly, if one perceives what does not belong to another as not belonging to another,

original: yongs su bzung ba dang bcas par 'du shes ba yang sbom po kho na'o //
analyzed: yongs su bzung ba dang bcas par 'du shes ba yang sbom po kho na'o //
translated: or if one perceives what belongs to another as belonging to another, it is only a serious violation.🔽If it belongs to another realm,

original: 'gro ba gzhan gyir ro zhes bya ba ni rang gi rdzas la 'gro ba gzhan gyir 'du shes na zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: 'gro ba gzhan gyir ro zhes bya ba ni rang gi rdzas la 'gro ba gzhan gyir 'du shes na zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: if one perceives one's own property as belonging to another realm,

original: mi'i 'gro ba las gzhan pa'i 'gro ba gang yin pa de ni 'gro ba gzhan no //
analyzed: mi'i 'gro ba las gzhan pa'i 'gro ba gang yin pa de ni 'gro ba gzhan no //
translated: another realm is any realm other than the human realm.

original: rang gi rdzas la 'gro ba gzhan gyis yongs su bzung bar 'du shes pas brkus na /
analyzed: rang gi rdzas la 'gro ba gzhan gyis yongs su bzung bar 'du shes pas brkus na /
translated: If one steals one's own property, perceiving it as belonging to another realm,

original: dngos gzhi'i yan lag yod du zin kyang sbom po ste /
analyzed: dngos gzhi'i yan lag yod du zin kyang sbom po ste /
translated: then even if the branch of the actual basis exists, it is only a serious violation.

original: der 'du shes pas so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: der 'du shes pas so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that it is a serious violation because of that perception.

original: 'dir gzhung ni de 'di snyam du gal te bya'i brku'i mi'i ni ma yin no snyam na zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni de 'di snyam du gal te bya'i brku'i mi'i ni ma yin no snyam na zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: Here, the text is “If one thinks, ‘This is not a human being, but a bird,’ and so on.

original: 'gro ba gzhan gyi la mi'i 'gro ba par 'du shes pa na yang sbom po kho na'o //🔽yongs sum bzung bar 'du shes pa na yang sbom po kho na'o ;
analyzed: 'gro ba gzhan gyi la mi'i 'gro ba par 'du shes pa na yang sbom po kho na'o // yongs sum bzung bar 'du shes pa na yang sbom po kho na'o ;
translated: Even if one perceives the life-stream of another human being, it is still a serious transgression.🔽Even if one perceives the life-stream of a human being who is under the protection of a king, it is still a serious transgression.

original: / bdag nyid kyir bdag gir bya bar brkus na pham par 'gyur bar bstan na /
analyzed: / bdag nyid kyir bdag gir bya bar brkus na pham par 'gyur bar bstan na /
translated: Having taught that stealing what belongs to oneself is a defeating offense,

original: bdag po dang dbral ba'i sems 'ba' zhig gis na cir 'gyur zhe na de'i phyir /🔽bdag gir ma byas pa sba ba dang / chud gzan pa dang / zin pa btang ba la sogs pas bral bar byed na yang ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: bdag po dang dbral ba'i sems 'ba' zhig gis na cir 'gyur zhe na de'i phyir / bdag gir ma byas pa sba ba dang / chud gzan pa dang / zin pa btang ba la sogs pas bral bar byed na yang ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: what happens if one steals with the mere thought of separating it from its owner?🔽Therefore it is said, “Even if one steals what is not taken possession of, such as treasure, or what has been lost, or what has been abandoned, it is still a serious transgression.”

original: bdag gir ma byas par sba ba la sogs pas bdag po dang bral bar byed na yang sbom po'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: bdag gir ma byas par sba ba la sogs pas bdag po dang bral bar byed na yang sbom po'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Even if one steals what has not been taken possession of, such as treasure, and so on, it is still a serious transgression.

original: sba ba zhes bya ba ni 'dir 'dam rdzab tu gzhug pa la sogs par bstan to //
analyzed: sba ba zhes bya ba ni 'dir 'dam rdzab tu gzhug pa la sogs par bstan to //
translated: “Concealed” means here to be submerged in a swamp, and so on.

original: chud gzan pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chud gzan pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Abandoned” means

original: bsregs pa dang bcad pa dang dral ba la sogs pa'i @104a * //
analyzed: bsregs pa dang bcad pa dang dral ba la sogs pa'i @104a * //
translated: to be burned, cut, torn, and so on.

original: bdag nyid do //
analyzed: bdag nyid do //
translated: “Seized” means🔽to be caught in a trap or a net, and so on.

original: zin pa btang ba zhes bya ba ni /🔽ri dags dang nya la sogs pa rlubs dang dol la sogs pas zin pa dag de'i yang ma gyur cig / bdag gir yang ma gyur cig snyam nas /
analyzed: zin pa btang ba zhes bya ba ni / ri dags dang nya la sogs pa rlubs dang dol la sogs pas zin pa dag de'i yang ma gyur cig / bdag gir yang ma gyur cig snyam nas /
translated: “Released” means🔽to release those caught in a trap or a net, and so on, thinking, “May they not be mine, may they not be mine!”

original: gzhan gyi rngon rnyil sogs pas zin pa bdag gis thug thub tu btang ba ste ;
analyzed: gzhan gyi rngon rnyil sogs pas zin pa bdag gis thug thub tu btang ba ste ;
translated: and to release those caught by others, thinking, “May they not be theirs, may they not be theirs!”

original: de dag thams cad sbom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag thams cad sbom por 'gyur ro //
translated: All of these are grave offenses.

original: sogs pa zhes smos pas ne rnam pa gzhan yang bsdu ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: sogs pa zhes smos pas ne rnam pa gzhan yang bsdu ba'i phyir te /
translated: The phrase “and so on” is stated to include other types of killing.

original: ji ltar gang yang rung ba'i rgyud kyis yongs su bzung ba la gang yang rung bar 'du shes pas ma sha ka lnga la sogs pa las nyung ba bral bar byas na nyes byas yin ba de bzhin du mi'i rgyud kyis yongs su bzung ba la 'gro ba
analyzed: ji ltar gang yang rung ba'i rgyud kyis yongs su bzung ba la gang yang rung bar 'du shes pas ma sha ka lnga la sogs pa las nyung ba bral bar byas na nyes byas yin ba de bzhin du mi'i rgyud kyis yongs su bzung ba la 'gro ba
translated: Just as it is a wrong action to steal less than five māsakas and so on of any substance belonging to any being through the perception that it is that substance, so too, if one steals less than the value of a kārṣāpaṇa of a substance belonging to a human through the perception that it belongs to another being, it is a wrong action.

original: gzhan gyi rgyud kyis yongs su bzung bar 'du shes pas bral bar byas pa la sbom po'i dbang du byas pa las nyung bas kyang nyes byas so //🔽de bzhin du mi ma yin pa'i rgyud kyis yongs su bzung ba la mi'i rgyud kyis yongs su bzung ba'am /
analyzed: gzhan gyi rgyud kyis yongs su bzung bar 'du shes pas bral bar byas pa la sbom po'i dbang du byas pa las nyung bas kyang nyes byas so // de bzhin du mi ma yin pa'i rgyud kyis yongs su bzung ba la mi'i rgyud kyis yongs su bzung ba'am /
translated: Similarly, if one steals less than the value of a kārṣāpaṇa of a substance belonging to a human through the perception that it belongs to a nonhuman being, it is a wrong action.

original: mi ma yin pa'i rgyud kyis yongs su bzung bar 'du shes pas bral bar byas kyang nyes byas kho na'o //
analyzed: mi ma yin pa'i rgyud kyis yongs su bzung bar 'du shes pas bral bar byas kyang nyes byas kho na'o //
translated: Similarly, if one steals less than the value of a kārṣāpaṇa of a substance belonging to a nonhuman being through the perception that it belongs to a human being or a nonhuman being, it is a wrong action.

original: ji ltar gzhan du rku sems kyis ltung bar byas pa bzhin du 'dir ni dbral ba'i 'du shes kyis ltung bar byas pa nyid do //
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan du rku sems kyis ltung bar byas pa bzhin du 'dir ni dbral ba'i 'du shes kyis ltung bar byas pa nyid do //
translated: Just as in other cases, here one commits a downfall through the perception of stealing, one commits a downfall through the perception of separating it from its location.

original: yongs su ma bzung ba la yongs su bzung ba dang bcas pa'am /
analyzed: yongs su ma bzung ba la yongs su bzung ba dang bcas pa'am /
translated: It is to not be attached to what is not one’s own.🔽

original: yongs su ma bzung bar 'du shes pa la ni ltung ba med de /
analyzed: yongs su ma bzung bar 'du shes pa la ni ltung ba med de /
translated: There is no offense if one does not take possession of what is not given, or if one perceives that it is not taken possession of.

original: dbral ba'i bsam pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbral ba'i bsam pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no offense if one has no intention to steal.

original: gnod pa byas pa'i sems kyis phral ba las sbom por smras na sems gzhan gyis phral ba la ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gnod pa byas pa'i sems kyis phral ba las sbom por smras na sems gzhan gyis phral ba la ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If one says that it is a serious transgression to take possession of what is not given with the intention to harm, how is it if one takes possession of it with another mind?

original: de'i phyir snying rje dang ldan pa'i sems kyis na nyes byas so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir snying rje dang ldan pa'i sems kyis na nyes byas so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it is said that it is a minor offense if one does so with a compassionate mind.

original: bzung ba btang ba la sogs ba gzhan gyi don dang bral bar byad pa la snying rje'i sems kyis byed na ni gzhan @104b gyis yongs su bzung ba dang bcas par 'du shes na yang nyes byas so //
analyzed: bzung ba btang ba la sogs ba gzhan gyi don dang bral bar byad pa la snying rje'i sems kyis byed na ni gzhan @104b gyis yongs su bzung ba dang bcas par 'du shes na yang nyes byas so //
translated: If one releases what is taken possession of and so on for the sake of others, if one does so with a compassionate mind, then even if one perceives that it is taken possession of by another, it is a minor offense.

original: pham par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'i dngos gzhi'i sbyor ba la sbom por smras na /
analyzed: pham par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'i dngos gzhi'i sbyor ba la sbom por smras na /
translated: If one says that it is a serious transgression to engage in the basis called “defeat,”

original: pham par 'gyur ba ma byas pa kho nar gal te bar skabs su phyir log par gyur na de la sbom por mi 'gyur bar dogs pa ldog pa'i phyir /
analyzed: pham par 'gyur ba ma byas pa kho nar gal te bar skabs su phyir log par gyur na de la sbom por mi 'gyur bar dogs pa ldog pa'i phyir /
translated: If one does not commit the defeat but returns in the interim, then in order to stop the doubt that it would be a serious transgression,

original: sngar byas na phyir bcos kyang ma byas pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: sngar byas na phyir bcos kyang ma byas pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: it is said that it is not that the prior action is not amended.

original: khyim de na bud med ni mang skyes pa ni nyung ngo zhes sngar sbran pa la sogs pas byung ba'i mtha'i sbyor ba byas na /🔽'di ltar phyis bcos pa rkun po rnams phyir bzlog pa'i phyir gnyen po byas su zin kyang de lta mos kyi /
analyzed: khyim de na bud med ni mang skyes pa ni nyung ngo zhes sngar sbran pa la sogs pas byung ba'i mtha'i sbyor ba byas na / 'di ltar phyis bcos pa rkun po rnams phyir bzlog pa'i phyir gnyen po byas su zin kyang de lta mos kyi /
translated: If one has previously warned a woman in a house that has many women and few men, and then engages in sexual union with her,

original: rkun po de'i rtsom pa'i dang por gyur pa gang yin pa'i rtsom pa'i dang por gyur pa de ma byas pa nyid ma yin gyi byas pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: rkun po de'i rtsom pa'i dang por gyur pa gang yin pa'i rtsom pa'i dang por gyur pa de ma byas pa nyid ma yin gyi byas pa nyid yin te /
translated: then even though one later amends it, it is not that the initial action of the composition of the crime is not committed, because one has committed it.

original: sbom po kho nar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽sbyor ba la ni sbom por smras la /
analyzed: sbom po kho nar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽sbyor ba la ni sbom por smras la /
translated: It is said that it is a serious transgression.🔽It is said that it is a serious transgression if one engages in sexual union.

original: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba la ni nyes byas su smras na /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba la ni nyes byas su smras na /
translated: If one says, “I will prepare the preparation,” it is a serious fault.

original: da ni de gnyis kyi yul gyi dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni de gnyis kyi yul gyi dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the classification of the objects of those two,

original: nom pa'i snga rol ni sbyor ba'i sbyor ba nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: nom pa'i snga rol ni sbyor ba'i sbyor ba nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: it is said, “The preparation of preparation is prior to the taking.”

original: brku bar bya ba'i rdzas la nom pa gang yin pa de'i snga rol du rang gi gnas nas khri las ldang ba dang / sham thabs la 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i bya ba gang yin pa'i bya ba de ni sbyor ba'i sbyor ba nyid de /
analyzed: brku bar bya ba'i rdzas la nom pa gang yin pa de'i snga rol du rang gi gnas nas khri las ldang ba dang / sham thabs la 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i bya ba gang yin pa'i bya ba de ni sbyor ba'i sbyor ba nyid de /
translated: The preparation of preparation is any action, such as rising from one’s seat and grasping one’s lower robe, prior to taking the object to be stolen, which is the object of the act of stealing.

original: sbyor ba sbom po'i sbyor ba ni sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba sbom po'i sbyor ba ni sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: The preparation of serious preparation is the preparation of preparation.

original: de'i dngos po ni de nyid do //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni de nyid do //
translated: Its nature is just that.

original: rim pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: rim pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The stages are as follows.

original: bsam pa'i dbye bas bya ba dbye'o //
analyzed: bsam pa'i dbye bas bya ba dbye'o //
translated: Action is differentiated by the differentiation of intention.

original: bya ba'i dbye bas ltung ba dbye'o zhes bya bas grub po //
analyzed: bya ba'i dbye bas ltung ba dbye'o zhes bya bas grub po //
translated: Downfalls are differentiated by the differentiation of action.🔽Here, the treatise states:

original: 'dir gzhung ni ji srid du nom par mi byed nyug par mi byed ba de srid du nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni ji srid du nom par mi byed nyug par mi byed ba de srid du nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: As long as one does not take or touch, for that long it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: nom par byed nyug par byed cing ji srid du gnas nas gnas su sbed par mi byed pa de srid du nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nom par byed nyug par byed cing ji srid du gnas nas gnas su sbed par mi byed pa de srid du nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: As long as one does not hide the stolen goods from one place to another, one commits a serious offense.

original: 'dir yang nom pa mang po dag la yang ji srid du rku ba'i bsam pa phyir ma log ba'i bar du ni sbom po gcig kho na'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang nom pa mang po dag la yang ji srid du rku ba'i bsam pa phyir ma log ba'i bar du ni sbom po gcig kho na'o //
translated: Here, even if one steals many things, as long as one does not abandon the intention to steal, one commits only one serious offense.

original: phyir bzlog pa'i bsam pa byung na ni yang phyis nom par byed pa na sbom po gzhan du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyir bzlog pa'i bsam pa byung na ni yang phyis nom par byed pa na sbom po gzhan du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one abandons the intention to steal and later steals again, one commits another serious offense.

original: sbyor ba thams cad la nyes byas zhes smras na /
analyzed: sbyor ba thams cad la nyes byas zhes smras na /
translated: If it is said that there is an offense of wrong conduct for every application,

original: ji ltar khri las ldang bar byed pa de la sogs ba'i sbyor ba dag la nyes byas gcig kho nar 'dod pa de bzhin du thams cad la yang yin nam zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar khri las ldang bar byed pa de la sogs ba'i sbyor ba dag la nyes byas gcig kho nar 'dod pa de bzhin du thams cad la yang yin nam zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: then just as it is asserted that there is only one offense of wrong conduct for the application of rising from one's seat and so on, is it the same for all?

original: phri ba'i gom pa re re la tha dad pa yin no zhes bya ba smras te /🔽dge @105a * //
analyzed: phri ba'i gom pa re re la tha dad pa yin no zhes bya ba smras te /🔽dge @105a * //
translated: Therefore it is said that for each step of stealing, there is a separate offense.

original: slong lam du zhugs pa gang zhig gzhan gyi rgyud kyis yongs su bzung ba'i rdzas gom pa phri bas brku bar 'dod nas gom pa 'bri bar byed cing khad kyis khad kyis phyir nur na gom pa phri ba de'i phri ba'i gom pa re re la sbyor ba'i
analyzed: slong lam du zhugs pa gang zhig gzhan gyi rgyud kyis yongs su bzung ba'i rdzas gom pa phri bas brku bar 'dod nas gom pa 'bri bar byed cing khad kyis khad kyis phyir nur na gom pa phri ba de'i phri ba'i gom pa re re la sbyor ba'i
translated: One who enters the path of stealing, who wishes to steal the property held in the possession of another, and who takes steps backward, gradually backing away, commits a separate preparation for each step backward.

original: sbyor ba tha dad pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba tha dad pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that there is a separate preparation for each step.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is explained as follows:

original: gang nas mi snang bar 'gro ba'i rkang pa bteg pa'i rkang pa bteg pa de ni sbyor pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: gang nas mi snang bar 'gro ba'i rkang pa bteg pa'i rkang pa bteg pa de ni sbyor pa nyid yin no //
translated: The lifting of the foot from where one is standing is the preparation.

original: rkang pa bteg pa snga ma gzhan dag la ni sbyor ba tha dad pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: rkang pa bteg pa snga ma gzhan dag la ni sbyor ba tha dad pa nyid yin no //
translated: The previous lifting of the foot in other places is a separate preparation.

original: des na mi snang bar 'gro ba'i phyir rkang pa bteg pa'i snga rol gyi rkang pa bteg ba gzhan re re la nyes byas re rer 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: des na mi snang bar 'gro ba'i phyir rkang pa bteg pa'i snga rol gyi rkang pa bteg ba gzhan re re la nyes byas re rer 'gyur ro ;
translated: Therefore, for each lifting of the foot prior to going out of sight, there is a single misdeed.

original: /'dir gzhung ni 'di ltar mkhan po dang slob dpon lam gyi bgrod par zhugs pa de dag gis lhan cig gnas pa dang / nye gnas de dag gi lag tu chos gos dag gtad pa na da la de dag rku sems nye bar gnas par gyur cing de dag gom pa bsri bas 'gro zhing spyang 'brang du 'gro ba na ji srid mig sngar snang bar gyur pa de srid du nyes
analyzed: /'dir gzhung ni 'di ltar mkhan po dang slob dpon lam gyi bgrod par zhugs pa de dag gis lhan cig gnas pa dang / nye gnas de dag gi lag tu chos gos dag gtad pa na da la de dag rku sems nye bar gnas par gyur cing de dag gom pa bsri bas 'gro zhing spyang 'brang du 'gro ba na ji srid mig sngar snang bar gyur pa de srid du nyes
translated: “Here, the text says that when the preceptors and masters who have entered the path of practice entrust their robes to their attendants and disciples, the latter may harbor thoughts of theft and walk away with slow steps, following behind. As long as they are within sight, they have committed a minor offense.🔽

original: pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, the text is as follows: “When those preceptors and teachers who have entered the path of travel entrust their Dharma robes to those who live with them and to their attendants, if the latter have a mind to steal, and they walk slowly, and they go in the direction of a wilderness, then as long as they are in sight, there is a serious offense.

original: mig sngar snang bar ma gyur pa na brkus par brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: mig sngar snang bar ma gyur pa na brkus par brjod par bya ste /
translated: If they are not in sight, it should be said that they have been stolen.

original: rin thang brtsi bar bya zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rin thang brtsi bar bya zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The value should be assessed, and so on.

original: bya ba gcig yin pa'i phyir ltung ba gcig tu 'gyur ro snyam du dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bya ba gcig yin pa'i phyir ltung ba gcig tu 'gyur ro snyam du dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to dispel the doubt that there would be a single downfall because there is a single action,

original: de'i gzhi la ni sems can so so la'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i gzhi la ni sems can so so la'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: it is said, “The basis for that is for each sentient being.”

original: tha dad par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: tha dad par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: It should be connected with “there is a separate offense.”

original: de'i gzhi la ni zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i gzhi la ni zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase in dependence upon that basis means that the basis is the dependent nature.

original: sems can gyi gzhi la ste /🔽sems can gyi gzhi la brkus pa dang / mtshon gyis btab pa dang / gzas pa dang / skur pa btab pa la sogs pa byed pa na /
analyzed: sems can gyi gzhi la ste / sems can gyi gzhi la brkus pa dang / mtshon gyis btab pa dang / gzas pa dang / skur pa btab pa la sogs pa byed pa na /
translated: The basis of that is the basis of sentient beings.

original: sems can so so la dngos gzhi dang sbyor ba'i bdag nyid kyi ltung ba tha dad do //🔽dper na dge slong gis gnas nas spo ba la sogs ba'i sbyor ba gcig gis bdag po mang po'i rdzas rku zhing ma sha ka lnga la sogs pa'i gzhi yang tshang bar gyur na sems can so so las pham par 'gyur zhing sbom po zhes bya ba'i sbyor
analyzed: sems can so so la dngos gzhi dang sbyor ba'i bdag nyid kyi ltung ba tha dad do // dper na dge slong gis gnas nas spo ba la sogs ba'i sbyor ba gcig gis bdag po mang po'i rdzas rku zhing ma sha ka lnga la sogs pa'i gzhi yang tshang bar gyur na sems can so so las pham par 'gyur zhing sbom po zhes bya ba'i sbyor
translated: When one steals, kills, or reviles sentient beings, then for each sentient being there is a separate downfall that is the actual basis and the preparation.

original: ba ni gcig kho nar 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: ba ni gcig kho nar 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, if a monk steals the property of many owners through a single preparation, such as banishment from a place, and the basis of five māsakas and so on is complete, then for each sentient being there is a root downfall.

original: gang gi tshe sems can so so las gzhi ma tshang bar gyur na ni de'i tshe sems can so so las sbom po tha dad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe sems can so so las gzhi ma tshang bar gyur na ni de'i tshe sems can so so las sbom po tha dad par 'gyur te /
translated: But if the basis is incomplete for each sentient being, then for each sentient being there is a separate serious downfall.

original: dper na dge slong gis mda'i sbyor ba gcig gis mi mang bo dag la 'phangs na de'i tshe sems can so so las spom po tha dad par 'gyur la /
analyzed: dper na dge slong gis mda'i sbyor ba gcig gis mi mang bo dag la 'phangs na de'i tshe sems can so so las spom po tha dad par 'gyur la /
translated: For example, if a monk shoots many people with one arrow, then the gross nonvirtuous karma is the same for each sentient being.

original: @105b nyes byas ni gcig kho nar 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: @105b nyes byas ni gcig kho nar 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
translated: But if he shoots them with many arrows, then the gross nonvirtuous karma is separate for each sentient being.

original: nom pa dang nyug pa sbom por smras na gru la thag pas btags pa de la reg pas thag pa dang phur ba la nom pa dang / nyug pa'i tshe sbom por dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: nom pa dang nyug pa sbom por smras na gru la thag pas btags pa de la reg pas thag pa dang phur ba la nom pa dang / nyug pa'i tshe sbom por dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: If one says that touching and scratching are gross nonvirtuous karma, then when one touches the rope tied to the boat and scratches the rope and stake in order to remove doubt about gross nonvirtuous karma,

original: phur pa las bkrol ba ni gru la reg pa ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: phur pa las bkrol ba ni gru la reg pa ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: one says that one does not touch the boat when one releases the stake.

original: ji ltar gru phur pa las dgrol bar byed pa na /
analyzed: ji ltar gru phur pa las dgrol bar byed pa na /
translated: Just as when one releases the boat from the stake,

original: de la reg par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la reg par mi 'gyur te /
translated: one does not touch it.

original: des na thag pa la reg pa na sbyor ba'i sbyor ba nyid de /
analyzed: des na thag pa la reg pa na sbyor ba'i sbyor ba nyid de /
translated: Therefore, when one touches the rope, the application of the application is

original: nyes byas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nyes byas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: the so-called minor offense.

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong gis rku sems kyis gru phur pa la btags pa skyod par byed na nyes su 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong gis rku sems kyis gru phur pa la btags pa skyod par byed na nyes su 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here the treatise states that if a fully ordained monk moves a boat to which he has tied a rope with the intention to steal it, he commits an offense.🔽In general, it is said that if one conceals an object from one place to another, it is called stealing.

original: gnas nas gnas su sbed par byed na brkus ba zhes bya'o zhes spyir sbyor ba byas pa de'i dmigs kyis bsal bar bya bar 'dod nas /
analyzed: gnas nas gnas su sbed par byed na brkus ba zhes bya'o zhes spyir sbyor ba byas pa de'i dmigs kyis bsal bar bya bar 'dod nas /
translated: In order to make an exception to that general rule, it is said:

original: de byas nas rku ba la ni khur brkus pas na'o zhes bya ba smras te /🔽de byas nas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de byas nas rku ba la ni khur brkus pas na'o zhes bya ba smras te / de byas nas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If one steals after making it a burden, one steals the burden.

original: khur du byas nas gzod rku'o snyam pa'o //
analyzed: khur du byas nas gzod rku'o snyam pa'o //
translated: Making it a burden means thinking, I will steal it after making it a burden.

original: de ltar rku ba la ni nam khur du drags te khur brkus pa na brkus pa kho na yin par rig par bya'i /
analyzed: de ltar rku ba la ni nam khur du drags te khur brkus pa na brkus pa kho na yin par rig par bya'i /
translated: If one steals in that way, it should be understood that when the burden is heavy and one steals the burden, one commits the actual basis of stealing.

original: yan lag de dag bsdus pa'i tshe na ni bkrus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yan lag de dag bsdus pa'i tshe na ni bkrus pa ma yin no //
translated: But when those branches are combined, it is not the actual basis.

original: 'di skad bstan te /🔽gang gi tshe rlung gis gos dag rnam par gtor bar gyur pa'am /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te / gang gi tshe rlung gis gos dag rnam par gtor bar gyur pa'am /
translated: This is explained as follows.

original: rdzas gzhan gtor bar gyur pa na dge slong gis de dag khur du drags te /
analyzed: rdzas gzhan gtor bar gyur pa na dge slong gis de dag khur du drags te /
translated: When the wind scatters garments or scatters other objects, if a fully ordained monk makes them a heavy burden and steals them,

original: rku'o snyam pa'i bsam pa des de dag sdud par byed na /
analyzed: rku'o snyam pa'i bsam pa des de dag sdud par byed na /
translated: If one gathers them with the thought “I will steal them,”

original: 'di ltar ma sha ka lnga la sogs pa'i rin thang gi tshad kyis gos la sogs pa dag khur drags pa'i snga rol du gnas nas spo bar byed kyang de ltar na yang pham bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar ma sha ka lnga la sogs pa'i rin thang gi tshad kyis gos la sogs pa dag khur drags pa'i snga rol du gnas nas spo bar byed kyang de ltar na yang pham bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: then even if one moves the cloth and so on to a place where it is not visible before the value of five māsakas and so on is reached, one does not commit a pārājika offense.

original: de'i tshe na de la bsdu'o snyam pa'i blo yod kyi /
analyzed: de'i tshe na de la bsdu'o snyam pa'i blo yod kyi /
translated: At that time, one has the thought “I will gather this,”

original: rku'o snyam pa'i blo med pa'i phyir ro //🔽'dir gzhung ni 'di ltar btso blag mkhan gyi gos dag bting ba rlung gis khyer zhing dge slong gis de la sbyor bas ji srid du nom par mi byed nyug par mi byed pa de srid du nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rku'o snyam pa'i blo med pa'i phyir ro // 'dir gzhung ni 'di ltar btso blag mkhan gyi gos dag bting ba rlung gis khyer zhing dge slong gis de la sbyor bas ji srid du nom par mi byed nyug par mi byed pa de srid du nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: but one does not have the thought “I will steal it.”🔽Here is the text: A monk who is engaged in moving cloth that is spread out by a cloth dyer and is carried away by the wind commits an offense of wrong conduct for as long as he does not touch it or move it.

original: non par byed nyug par byed gos dag sdud par byed bam por bsgre bar byed cing ji srid du gnas nas gnas su sbed par mi byed pa de srid du nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: non par byed nyug par byed gos dag sdud par byed bam por bsgre bar byed cing ji srid du gnas nas gnas su sbed par mi byed pa de srid du nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
translated: If he touches it or moves it, he commits a serious offense for as long as he does not gather the cloth, roll it up, and hide it from one place to another.

original: gnas nas gnas su sped par byed na brkus par brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: gnas nas gnas su sped par byed na brkus par brjod par bya ste /
translated: If one steals it from one place to another, it is called stealing.

original: rin thang brtsi bar bya zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rin thang brtsi bar bya zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The value of the object is to be assessed.

original: bsdus nas ni phung po na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: bsdus nas ni phung po na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: If one steals a heap, it is a heap of the aggregates.

original: btus nas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: btus nas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The term “heap” means

original: btus zin nas gzod rku'o snyam @106a * //
analyzed: btus zin nas gzod rku'o snyam @106a * //
translated: that one thinks “I will steal it” after it has been collected.

original: pa'o ; / de ltar rku ba la ni nam btus zin te spungs pa'i phung po brkus na brkus pa kho na yin par rig par bya'i /
analyzed: pa'o ; / de ltar rku ba la ni nam btus zin te spungs pa'i phung po brkus na brkus pa kho na yin par rig par bya'i /
translated: Thus, when one steals a heap of collected objects, it should be understood that it is only stealing when the heap has been collected.

original: yan lag de dag btus pa'i tshe na ni brkus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yan lag de dag btus pa'i tshe na ni brkus pa ma yin no //
translated: But it is not stealing when the parts are collected.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is taught.

original: gang gi tshe dge slong me tog dang 'bras bu dag 'thog par byed cing btogs nas gzod brku'o snyam pa'i bsam pa des rin thang ma sha ka lnga la sogs pa'i tshad cig btogs na yang de'i tshe nam phung por bcer ba kho na brkus na brkus pa
analyzed: gang gi tshe dge slong me tog dang 'bras bu dag 'thog par byed cing btogs nas gzod brku'o snyam pa'i bsam pa des rin thang ma sha ka lnga la sogs pa'i tshad cig btogs na yang de'i tshe nam phung por bcer ba kho na brkus na brkus pa
translated: When a monk plucks flowers and fruit, and with the intention of stealing them, plucks a heap of a certain value, such as five coins, then at that time, when the heap is collected, it is stealing.

original: yin gyi / me tog la sogs pa btogs pa de ni brkus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yin gyi / me tog la sogs pa btogs pa de ni brkus pa ma yin te /
translated: The flowers, etc. that are plucked are not stolen,

original: 'di ltar de la btogs pa'i bsam pa yod par zad kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar de la btogs pa'i bsam pa yod par zad kyi /
translated: because although there is the intention to pluck them,

original: rku ba'i bsam pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rku ba'i bsam pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: there is no intention to steal them.🔽Here is the text:

original: 'dir gzhung ni 'di ltar dge slong khri las ldang ba nas /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni 'di ltar dge slong khri las ldang ba nas /
translated: “A monk who rises from his seat and plucks flowers, etc.

original: ji srid du nom par mi byed nyug par mi byed pa de srid du nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji srid du nom par mi byed nyug par mi byed pa de srid du nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: up to the point where he does not examine or touch them, commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: nom par byed nyug par byed me tog gi shing la 'dzeg par byed me tog 'thog par byed thu ba 'gengs par byed cing ji srid du gnas nas gnas su sbed par mi byed pa de srid du nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs
analyzed: nom par byed nyug par byed me tog gi shing la 'dzeg par byed me tog 'thog par byed thu ba 'gengs par byed cing ji srid du gnas nas gnas su sbed par mi byed pa de srid du nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs
translated: When he examines and touches them, climbs a tree for flowers, plucks flowers, fills his carrying net, and as long as he does not conceal them from place to place, he commits a serious offense.

original: pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is what is being said.🔽

original: gal te dge slong gis chu la sogs pa dag tu shing la sogs pa dag spyings te /
analyzed: gal te dge slong gis chu la sogs pa dag tu shing la sogs pa dag spyings te /
translated: If a monk throws wood, etc. into water, etc.

original: rku na gang gi tshe brkus par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: rku na gang gi tshe brkus par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: and steals it, when does the stealing occur?

original: de'i phyir / spyings pa la ni gnas kyi steng nas rdzas kyi steng bying na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / spyings pa la ni gnas kyi steng nas rdzas kyi steng bying na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said:🔽When it sinks in the water, etc., it is stolen if it sinks in the place or on the substance.

original: brku ba'i rdzas kyi steng gnas kyi steng nas bying na spyings pa'i tshe brkus pa yin par sbyar ro //
analyzed: brku ba'i rdzas kyi steng gnas kyi steng nas bying na spyings pa'i tshe brkus pa yin par sbyar ro //
translated: When the object to be stolen sinks in the water, etc., it is stolen if it sinks in the place or on the substance.

original: chu la sogs par spyings pa la ni /
analyzed: chu la sogs par spyings pa la ni /
translated: When it sinks in the water, etc.,

original: brku bar bya ba'i rdzas kyi gnas ni chu la sogs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: brku bar bya ba'i rdzas kyi gnas ni chu la sogs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: the place of the object to be stolen is the water, etc.

original: gnas de'i steng ni ya mtha'i cha'i steng rim mo //
analyzed: gnas de'i steng ni ya mtha'i cha'i steng rim mo //
translated: The upper part of that place is the upper part of the water, etc.

original: steng rim de nas 'das shing nub pa ni bying ba'o //
analyzed: steng rim de nas 'das shing nub pa ni bying ba'o //
translated: When it passes beyond that upper part and sinks, it is stolen.

original: gang bying zhe na de'i phyir rdzas kyi steng zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gang bying zhe na de'i phyir rdzas kyi steng zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: What is stolen? Therefore, it is said: on the substance.

original: brku bar bya ba'i rdzas de'i ya bla'i cha'i steng rim de bying na'o //
analyzed: brku bar bya ba'i rdzas de'i ya bla'i cha'i steng rim de bying na'o //
translated: When it sinks in the upper part of the substance, it is stolen.

original: rdzas kyi steng de gnas kyi steng bying na rdzas de brkus par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rdzas kyi steng de gnas kyi steng bying na rdzas de brkus par rig par bya ste /
translated: When it sinks in the place or on the substance, that substance is known to be stolen.

original: rdzas kyi steng zhes bya ba'i tshig gis ni rdzas kyi dngos po de'i mtha' dag nub par bstan pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rdzas kyi steng zhes bya ba'i tshig gis ni rdzas kyi dngos po de'i mtha' dag nub par bstan pa yin gyi /
translated: The words “on the substance” indicate that the entire substance is submerged.

original: thur du lta ba'i ngos 'og ma'i chu nub pa tsam gyis ni ma yin par bstan to //
analyzed: thur du lta ba'i ngos 'og ma'i chu nub pa tsam gyis ni ma yin par bstan to //
translated: It is not merely the lower side facing downward that is submerged.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is explained as follows.

original: brku bar bya ba'i rdzas shing la sogs pa gang yin pa de gal te gnas kyi rdzas chu la sogs par thams cad ril @106b gyis nub par gyur na de'i tshe na brkus pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: brku bar bya ba'i rdzas shing la sogs pa gang yin pa de gal te gnas kyi rdzas chu la sogs par thams cad ril @106b gyis nub par gyur na de'i tshe na brkus pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If the substance to be stolen, such as wood, is completely submerged in the substance of the location, such as water, then at that time it is called “stolen.”

original: 'di la kha cig 'di skad rgol te /
analyzed: 'di la kha cig 'di skad rgol te /
translated: Here, some argue as follows:

original: gal te dge slong de'i bsam pa 'di snyam du da ni re zhig spying bar bya'i phyis ni dbyung bar bya'o snyam pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te dge slong de'i bsam pa 'di snyam du da ni re zhig spying bar bya'i phyis ni dbyung bar bya'o snyam pa yin na /
translated: If the monk thinks, “For now I will submerge it, later I will pull it out,”

original: de la gnas kyi steng nas rdzas kyi steng du bying na brkus pa'o zhes bya ba 'di mi rung ste ;
analyzed: de la gnas kyi steng nas rdzas kyi steng du bying na brkus pa'o zhes bya ba 'di mi rung ste ;
translated: then it is not correct to say that if it sinks from the location onto the substance, it is stolen,

original: rku ba'i bsam pa de'i tshe na med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: rku ba'i bsam pa de'i tshe na med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because at that time the intention to steal is absent.

original: rgol ba de bsal ba'i phyir phyis dbyung ngo snyam pa'i blo gros gang yin pa de ni bskur ba'i 'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: rgol ba de bsal ba'i phyir phyis dbyung ngo snyam pa'i blo gros gang yin pa de ni bskur ba'i 'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The intention to later take out the object is the intention to steal.

original: spying ba der phyis dbyung ngo snyam pa'i blo gros gang yin pa'i blo gros de ni bskur ba'i blo gros yin gyi gzod rku ba'i blo gros ni ma yin no //
analyzed: spying ba der phyis dbyung ngo snyam pa'i blo gros gang yin pa'i blo gros de ni bskur ba'i blo gros yin gyi gzod rku ba'i blo gros ni ma yin no //
translated: The intention to later take out the object is the intention to steal, but it is not the initial intention to steal.

original: gang gi phyir phyis dbyung ngo snyam na yang 'on kyang de nyid na rku sems skyes pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir phyis dbyung ngo snyam na yang 'on kyang de nyid na rku sems skyes pa yin gyi /
translated: Even though one thinks, I will take it out later, the thought to steal arises at that time.

original: gzhan du na ci'i phyir spyings par byed de /
analyzed: gzhan du na ci'i phyir spyings par byed de /
translated: Otherwise, why would one hide it?

original: de'i phyir dge slong rku sems skyes pas rdzas spying ba la sogs pa byed par 'gyur ro //🔽phyis dbyung ngo snyam pa'o zhes bya ba 'byin par byed ces bya ba'i skad kyi byings 'di yang bskur ba'i don yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir dge slong rku sems skyes pas rdzas spying ba la sogs pa byed par 'gyur ro // phyis dbyung ngo snyam pa'o zhes bya ba 'byin par byed ces bya ba'i skad kyi byings 'di yang bskur ba'i don yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, a monk who has the thought to steal hides the object and so on.🔽The root “to take out” has the meaning of hiding,

original: rku ba'i don ma yin no //
analyzed: rku ba'i don ma yin no //
translated: but it does not have the meaning of stealing.
